With this loan she intends to carry out repairs to one part of her house, to prevent rainwater from entering and getting her belongings wet, damaging them to the point that they have to be replaced. What she intends is to take advantage of the good-quality offers on the market in this end-of-year season. With the improvements she plans, she wants to avoid more losses of belongings, and thus have a little saving for the increased well-being of her family. Thus they will spend December with greater peace of mind and begin 2013 with better living conditions and a more positive outlook. This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR. She has not had other loans in the past from state banks, but FUDECOSUR provided the loan for her with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to carry out repairs to her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for beauty and hair products needed in his salon.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
Cirila, de 58 años; es una mujer dulce y amable. Vive sola en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Pampa blanca. Hace 27 años enviudó, junto al que fue su esposo, tubo 5 hijos todos ellos mayores y con familia propia.
Desde que su esposo murió dedicó su tiempo en cuidar de sus hijos y continuar con la siembra que su esposo, realizaba con mucho amor, él le enseñó las temporadas de sembrío como también los tipos de suelo aptos para realizar el cultivo, por ello ahora posee sembríos muy codiciados, ya que su secreto es hacer descansar la tierra, para que pueda producir un alimento mejor y nutritivo. Ella comercializa sus cosechas en el mercado de Pampas, todos los fines de semana, cuando tiene mucha producción los vende a los comerciantes de la capital del país, de donde se trasporta alimento para el resto de las ciudades. También cuenta con vacas y gallinas, las que la ayudan a obtener otros ingresos. Cuenta que cada vez que engordan sus vacas, los comercializa a los carniceros que llegan a la comunidad y las gallinas que posee, ponen huevos que vende a los pobladores de su pueblo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “pampa blanca” y este es el crédito número 9 con MFP, donde se siente feliz, ya que tiene muchos años trabajando con su asociación, donde los integrantes son personas, humanas y sobre todo con muchas ganas de ayudarse entre ellos.
Cirila, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de abono orgánico para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Cirila is 58 years old and is a sweet, friendly woman and she lives alone in her own home, located in Pampa Blanca.  It’s been 27 years since she became a widow and she has five adult children, each with their own families.

Since her husband passed away, she has spent her time caring for her children and the crops that her husband used to tend.  He taught her about the planting seasons and the types of soil that are best for each crop.  This is why she has such coveted crops.  Her secret is to let the land rest so that it can produce better nutrients.  She sells her harvest in the Pampas market every weekend.  When she has a large harvest, she sells to merchants in the nation’s capital, where food arrives from the other cities.

She also has cattle and chickens, which help provide another income.  She sells the cattle, when they are fattened up, to butches who visit the zone, and sells eggs to the people in town.  She is a member of the “Pampa Blanca” communal bank and this will be her 9th loan through MFP, where she is happy.  She has been working with the association for many years, and the members are very human and above all want to help one another.

Cirila will use the money from this loan to buy compost for her next crop.

loans.use: to buy compost.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en: Violeta, 45 years old, is from Looc, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has 5 children. Violeta owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of goods. She has been in her business for 10 years and earns 5,000 PHP a month from it. Violeta joined GDMPC in 2010. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy items such as milk, diapers, food products, etc. Violeta plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items such as milk, diapers, food products, etc.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen, 46 years old, is a widow who has 5 children. She is from Langub, Calamba, and has been farming for 5 years. Helen's main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale, and she earns PHP 3,000 a month. Helen recently joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of PHP 4,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Helen plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Rowena, 39, is married and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, with her 5 children. She has operated a business raising hogs for 3 years, earning a monthly income of PHP 12,700. Rowena joined GDMPC in 2011. She has applied for a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Rowena hopes for a good return on her investment and hopes to raise more pigs in the future.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for beauty and hair products needed in her salon.

loans.name: Tha's Group

texts.en:
Tha is from a rural village in the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, Cambodia. He is a 49-year-old married father of three sons, all of whom are dependents and work as garment workers to help support the family. 

He has struggled to feed his children by working for others for a fee while his wife works in a garment factory to earn additional income.  Tha and his wife have been in this business for 20 years.

Tha has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely paid back the past loans.  This is the first loan for Rem, the other member of the group.

Tha and Rem are requesting a loan of 160,000 KHR each.  As the leader, Tha will use his portion to buy materials to construct a decent latrine.  He will need cement, bricks, a latrine pan, etc. 

Tha hopes that this loan will enable his family to have a clean latrine for daily use and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy materials to construct a decent latrine.

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
Touch, aged 50, lives in a rural village of the Kandal Stoeng district.  She has one child who works in a garment factory to earn extra income for the family. 

Touch is a rice farmer to make a living and sometimes her husband works for others for a fee.  She and her husband have been in this business for 30 years. The current business earns her about KHR30,000 per day and allows her to save about KHR8,000 each day after daily expenses.
 
This is a micro loan for Touch with Kiva’s partner.  Now she is leading her group of three to ask for a loan.  As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy material for building a latrine, such as a toilet bowl, tile drainage etc. 

Touch hopes this loan will enable her to have a clean latrine for her family to use.

loans.use: to buy material for building a latrine.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria, 41, is a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Raul and has children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. Maria works hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses.  

Maria operates an accessory retail business. She buys accessory items (beaded jewelry such as necklaces, etc.) from a wholesaler and sells them per piece/pack for a profit. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options Maria offers. Her regular customers are students and mall patrons. Maria earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help continue operations of her business, Maria is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan to buy more quantities and varieties of accessory products to expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Maria hopes to give her children a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more quantities and varieties of accessory products to expand her inventory.

loans.name: Natalina

texts.en:
Natalina runs a kiosk that helps her generate income for her family.  She is requesting a loan of $1000 to improve her business.

Natalina will use the loan to buy items to keep in her store such as sleepers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) as well as biscuits. 

She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $200.  Natalina is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy items to resell at a profit.

loans.name: Emalyn

texts.en:
Emalyn, age 33, who has three children and lives in Nailon, Tudela, Misamis Occidental.  Emalyn cultivates rice for sale to earn a living. She has been in this business for six years. 

Each month, Emalyn earns 6,000 PHP.  She requests a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. 

Recently, Emalyn joined GDMPC which she hopes will help her improve and expand in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Ingracia

texts.en: Ingracia is applying for a loan of $1,000 to improve her car service business. She runs the business in front of her house and makes a good income from it. Ingracia want to use this loan to buy more stock and to pay the mechanic who works for her. She lives in town near the main road, so many people come to her to fix their cars. Ingracia opened her business in 2002 with her own working capital.

loans.use: to buy screws, hammers, nuts and other needed items to service cars

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria, de 32 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.  Está casada con Leonardo quien es mecánico y fruto de ésta unión tiene un hermoso hijo de  07 años de edad a quienes quieren mucho, habitando cómodamente  su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Gloria es la venta de abarrotes para eso cuenta con un bodega instalada en su propia casa, desde donde atiende a su clientes que en su mayoría son sus vecinos a quienes atiende de manera amable y cordial ganándose su preferencia.
 Iniciándose hace más de 08 años por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso adicional, contando con un préstamo más su  capital propio fruto de sus ahorros, los utilizó para comprar su mercadería en pequeñas cantidades , logrando hacerlo crecer aumentar sus clientes.
Considera rentable su negocio por las buenas ganancias que le deja y la buena acogida que está teniendo su negocio.
Le gusta su negocio pues le permite   estar en casa y contar con la tranquilidad de un ingreso económico, además del tiempo libre que lo puede emplear en el cuidado de su hogar. Pero  no le gusta cuando sus clientes le solicitan créditos por sus compras pues comenta ya tuvo malas experiencias con éste tipo de venta llegando a fallar con el pago, por eso ahora se niega y todo lo vende al contado, y tiene mejores resultados. Viendo los buenos resultados  tiene planes de seguir creciendo y ampliar su negocio. Por tanto éste será el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero para concretar sus planes. Además de estar a gusto con su banco comunal pues conoce a sus integrantes y los considera ser personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de abarrotes al por mayor buscando los precios  más bajos para así obtener mejores ganancias,  considera que a mayor cantidad y variedad su negocio seguirá teniendo una buena acogida y sus ganancias se incrementaran.
texts.en:
Gloria is 32 years old and is a hardworking woman with a great desire to get ahead.  She is married to Leonardo, who works as a mechanic and they have a seven year old son who they love very much.  They live comfortable in their home.  Gloria sells groceries and has a small store in her home, from where she happily tends to her customers who are mostly her neighbors and who prefer to buy from her.

She started this business more than eight years ago out of necessity for additional income.  She used her own money plus a loan to buy her merchandise in small amounts, later growing and increasing her number of customers.

She considers her business to be profitable because of the earnings it leaves her and the good results.

She likes her business because it allows her to stay at home and not worry about an income.  It also allows her free time that she can use to care for her home.  She doesn’t like when her customers ask for credit; she’s already had bad experience with this type of sales and people not paying.  Now she only sells for cash and she has better results.  She plans to continue growing the business and therefore this will be her second loan through MFP.  She is grateful for the financial support that will allow her to solidify her plans.  She also feels comfortable with her communal bank because she knows the other members and considers them to be responsible and united.

She will use the 1,000 PEN to invest in groceries in quantity, looking for the lowest prices to maximize her profits.  She believes that by having a greater amount and variety of goods on hand, her business will continue to be successful and her profits will continue to increase.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Loryn

texts.en:
This is Loryn, 29, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Marvin and a mother to her children.  She and her husband manage their household while operating a variety store business.  Loryn works hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses.

In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood.  It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, cooking oil, or an egg.  She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece.  Her regular customers are her neighbors in the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a Php20,000 loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.  She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Loryn dreams to own her own house and hopes to prvide a good life for her family.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.
------------------------------------
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Segundina

texts.en:
Segundina is 57 years old, married and and has seven children.  She lives in Yahong, Tudela and earns a living by selling firewood. 

She has been selling wood for 10 years and earns 2,000 a month.  

Segundina has applied for a loan of 8,500 at GDMPC to buy more firewood to sell. 

Segundina has been a member of GDMPC since 2011.  She hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell.

loans.name: Cheryhil

texts.en:
Cheryhil is from Garang, Tangub City.  He is 35 years old, married and has four children. 

To make a living, Cheryhil raises fish to sell.  He had been in business for 10 years and earns 5,000 PHP a month. 

In 2011, Cheryhil joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. 

Cheryhil is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase additional fish to sell.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Carlos Orlando

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre de 36 años, soltero, gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres logró terminar la escuela primaria y luego  la falta de recursos económicos lo llevó a trabajar desde muy chico para poder sustentar sus necesidades. A pesar de tener un trabajo que le demanda mucho tiempo y esfuerzo, él no se negó a educar y mantener a su pequeño hijo que en la actualidad tiene 2 años de edad y que por circunstancias adversas sufrió el abandono de su madre. Ahora Carlos vive con su hijo en el Pacto una parroquia del Cantón Quito ubicado en la Provincia de Pichincha en la República del Ecuador. Pacto está ubicado en el noroccidente del Distrito Metropolitano de Quito, su historia inicia en la época preincaica y su nombre se deriva de acuerdos realizados entre partidos políticos importantes. En cuanto a su economía, es una zona agrícola y ganadera, debido a su situación climática y geográfica, lo cual también produce efecto en las cosechas de las cuales se obtiene productos de la Región Costa como de la Región Sierra. Su gente vive al día a día de estas actividades, aunque es un lugar alejado de la ciudad, existen familias que han emprendido en todo tipo de actividades para cubrir sus necesidades y las de su comunidad. 
Carlos heredó de sus padres la habilidad para elaborar los ladrillos de panela,  un producto utilizado para endulzar en reemplazo del azúcar pero de forma más natural  y saludable que utiliza como materia prima la caña de azúcar y que además aporta vitaminas al organismo. Carlos dedica a esta actividad desde 8 a 10 horas cada día paralelamente con las actividades del hogar que incluyen el cuidado de su pequeño hijo. Carlos con la experiencia que ha adquirido a través de los años y experimentando el crecimiento que ha tenido la industria de la caña de azúcar y sus derivados en los últimos años, se siente preparado para dar un paso de crecimiento para lo cual solicita un crédito que lo utilizará en la compra de semillas de caña de azúcar y otros implementos que harán que su producción aumente para que Carlos pueda mejorar sus estilo de vida y el de su hijo, dándole la educación que él no tuvo la oportunidad de obtener en su juventud. Además a Carlos le gustaría en el futuro comprarse un vehículo que le permita llegar a más clientes que demandan el producto. Carlos agradece a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Carlos, 36, is a single man.  Thanks to his parents' efforts he was able to finish elementary school, but then their lack of financial resources sent him to work at a young age so he could support his needs.  Despite having a job that demands a lot of time and effort, he hasn't neglected raising and supporting his young son who currently is two years old and who, due to adverse circumstances, was abandoned by his mother.

Now Carlos lives with his son in Pacto, a parish in Quito Canton in the province of Pichincha in the Republic of Ecuador.  Pacto is located in the northwest of the Quito Metropolitan District.  Its history began in the pre-Inca period and its name comes from pacts made between important political parties.  With regard to its economy, it's an agricultural and livestock area because of its climate and geography.  This also affects the harvests, which produce coastal as well as highland crops.  The people there live every day from these activities; although it's far from the city, there are families that have undertaken every type of work to cover their necessities and those of their community.

Carlos inherited his parents' ability to make bricks of brown sugar, a sweetener that replaces sugar but in a more natural and healthy form that uses sugar cane as its raw material and that also has vitamins.  Carlos spends eight or ten hours a day on this job in addition to the household activities, including caring for his young child.  With the experience he has acquired over the years and the growth in the sugar cane industry in the last few years, he feels ready for growth.

This is why Carlos is requesting a loan to buy sugar cane seeds and other implements that will increase his production so he can improve his lifestyle and his son's.  He wants to give his son the education that he himself didn't have to opportunity to get in his youth.

Also, Carlos would like to buy himself a vehicle in the future so he can reach more customers who request his product.

Carlos is grateful to Fundación Alternativa in Ecuador and to Kiva for making possible his business growth and personal growth.

loans.use: to buy sugar cane seeds and supplies to make brown sugar

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
This is Alma.  She previously accessed a 25,000 PHP loan to purchase a variety of grocery items and products to sell in her store.  Her earnings were a big help to cover her children’s educational expenses, personal household costs and business expenditures.  Alma has an apartment and sells dried fish for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory.  The more items displayed at the store the better.  More items to sell will result in better profits.  Her profits will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expense.  She looks forward to this financial boost with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Alma hopes she will generate more business and dreams to give her children a good and quality education.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.
-------------------------------
* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory.

loans.name: Khurelbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Khurelbaatar, is 42 years old and lives with his family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

To earn a living, the family runs an agricultural business, planting vegetables and then selling them in Ulaanbaatar and Dornod, his home town. He has two warehouses, each with capacity of 7 tons, to store vegetables and other foods. Last autumn he collected 24 tons of potatoes that he had grown by planting 3 tons of seeds. He has remaining 17 tons of potatoes which are stored in warehouses. He is selling potatoes for 500 MNT for each kilogram. 

In order to cultivate the land and to improve the plants, he is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy fertilizers. The planting of vegetables has several benefits, such as improving the air we breathe and decorating the space we live in, as well as meeting the increasing food demand. Environmentally friendly businesses like this should be encouraged everywhere.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es: Fernando, de 21 años de edad, es un hombre amable y emprendedor. Es soltero y no tiene hijos. Vive en casa de sus padres, en compañía de sus 3 hermanos y padres a quienes apoya y quiere mucho. La actividad que realiza Fernando es la de electricista que consiste en realizar arreglos de equipos eléctricos, equipos de sonido entre otros. Aprendió este oficio estudiando en un centro de adiestramiento industrial.  Le gustó y decidió desarrollar esta función desde hace 2 años. Viendo que su mano de obra era requerida constantemente empezó a comprar los materiales básicos que se necesita para cumplir su labor con mejores resultados. Ahora trabaja con empresas privadas que necesitan de su servicio. Cuenta con la ayuda y complicidad de otro electricista quien le presta algunos equipos eléctricos con los que él no cuenta por ahora. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que le ha permitido tener ingresos económicos sustanciales con el cual poder pagar los gastos propios de su hogar y darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hermanos, lo que no le gusta de su actividad es el riesgo que implica su cumplimiento y tiene que estar hasta muy tarde en las noches para poder terminar y entregar los planos de electrificación que le piden en las fechas solicitadas. Estas horas de trabajo le han dado algunos malestares de salud, pero eso no lo desanima y sigue adelante. Desea instalar su propio taller de servicio eléctrico. Este es el préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP. Por ello agradece la confianza y la ayuda que le brindan para que pueda concretar sus planes. Asimismo, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como lo hizo en el crédito anterior. Comenta estar a gusto con su banco comunal pues conoce a sus miembros y los considera personas responsables. Con el préstamo solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, los invertirá en su totalidad comprar herramientas de básicas de electrificación como pinzas, algunos cables de aislamiento y otros.
texts.en:
Fernando is 21 years old and is a friendly, enterprising man.  He is single, doesn’t have any children, and lives with his parents and three siblings whom he supports and loves very much.  Fernando is an electrician who repairs electronic and sound equipment among other things.  He learned this trade at an industrial training center and he liked it and decided to develop this function two years ago.  Seeing that his labor was in constant demand, he bought basic supplies to be able to work better.

Now he works with private companies who need his services.  He has help from another electrician who loans him some electrical tools the he doesn’t have himself.  What he likes about this is that it allows him to have a substantial income with which he can pay his own household expenses and provide a better quality of life for his siblings.  What he doesn’t like is the risk that his commitment exposes him to risk, and that he has to work very late to be able to deliver by the due dates.  These working hours have caused him some health problems but it does not discourage him and he continues ahead.

He wants to set up his one electrician’s workshop.  This will be his second loan through MFP and he is grateful for the trust given him so that he can solidify his plans.  He also promises to make his payments on time, as with the previous loan.  He says that he likes being part of the communal bank because he knows the other members and he considers them all to be responsible people.  He will use the 1,500 PEN from this loan to buy basic electrical tools such as pliers, some cables, and other things.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a 52-year old resident of Kinuman Sur, Ozamis City.  She helps to meet her family's needs by working as a gardener.  She has been in business for 11 years. 

However, this year Rosemarie became a member of GDMPC, and she has applies for a loan of 5,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. 

Rosemarie wants to expand to her business one day.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for stick brooms, soft brooms, net bags, sand paper and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Shinehuu

texts.en: Mrs.Shinehuu is 53 years old and lives with her daughter in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent in the district of Ulaanbaatar in Mongolia. Her daughter, age 20, studies at the university and works part-time at a beauty salon. Her older children are married and live on their own. Shinehuu has been working at a state-owned company for years and she started her tailoring business in 2009. She rents a place and gets orders from her customers. She has built close relationships with her customers and suppliers over the years. She is now requesting 1,500,000 MNT to cover her daughter's university tuition and other expenses. She is a hardworking, responsible and well-experienced woman.

loans.use: to cover her daughter's university tuition and other expenses.

loans.name: Rolly

texts.en: Rolly, married, is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. He operates a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. He has been doing this for three years and every month he earns 7,000 PHP from this work. He has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories. Rolly is a new member of GDMPC. In the future, he hopes to gain double the income from his business.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Hureldavaa

texts.en: Hureldavaa is 54 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in a small house in Selenge province of Mongolia. His wife Zooyo, age 58, is retired and stays home helping her husband to grow organic vegetables. Her two sons, Hosshagai, age 26, and Hurelshagai, age 22, work at a private company as assistant workers. Hureldavaa also works at a local private company as a guardsman. He has been growing organic vegetables in his garden since 1995, first for just family use and now increasing the volume and selling the excess amount in the local market. He is now requesting 1,400,000 MNT to purchase organic vegetable seeds for next year's planting and also he needs to change their windows into vacuum windows in order to reduce the heat loss. He and his family members all are hardworking people.

loans.use: to purchase organic vegetable seeds for next year's planting and also he needs to change their windows into vacuum windows in order to reduce the heat loss

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
This is Marissa, she previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more herbal products for her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy more herbal products needed in her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. She also sells charcoal for additional income.

Marissa hopes to give her child and grandchild a good education and dreams of being married to her partner. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for an additional supply of herbal products needed in her business.

loans.name: Sancho

texts.en: Sancho is 26 years old, married and the father of two children. He lives in Maloro, Tangub City, where he has earned a living for the last five years by selling home and used products. He makes PHP 3,000 a month and is applying for a loan for PHP 6,000 to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. Sancho joined GDMPC in 2011 as a way to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is applying for a loan of $600 to improve her business and this is her first loan. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as biscuits, oil, sugar and sleepers.

Filomena opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital of $200. She is earning a good income and she will use the income to support her family and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, oil, sugar and sleepers.

loans.name: Bermet

texts.ru: Бермет 55 лет, замужем,дети Бермет уже взрослые и самостоятельные. Бермет с 1978 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с 6,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Бермет имеется 2 дойные коровы, 2 телочк и 50 МРС, ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 12,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молока и перепродажи скота. Доходы позволили Бермет создать необходимую базу для детей для создания их собственных семей. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бермет обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения прибыли от продажи молока. Доходы Бермет планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Bermet is 55 years old and is married.  Bermet's children are already grown and independent.  Bermet has been raising livestock and farming since 1978, having started this business with 6000 som (KGS).  Today, Bermet's holdings include 2 dairy cows, 2 calves and 50 small heads of livestock, her monthly income is around 12,000 som (KGS) from the sale of milk and resale of livestock.  The earnings have allowed Bermet to create a necessary base for her children to create their own families.  In order to further grow her business, Bermet has turned to "Bai Tushum and Partners" for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase cows to increase her income from the sale of milk.  Bermet plans to invest her earning into further increasing her business.

loans.use: to purchase cows

loans.name: Sonia Esperanza

texts.es: Cordiales saludos: Ella es Sonia una socia responsable y emprendedora, que con los deseos de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia inicia su negocio, la cual cuenta con un salón de belleza, negocio que apertura con su hermana, en el transcurso del tiempo y con mucho esfuerzo han llegado  a mejorar su salón de belleza implementándolo con la venta de artículos de belleza y golosinas. Se siente feliz y agradece a Kiva por colaborar en su progreso. Su mayor deseo es tener su propio salón de belleza. Solicito el crédito para seguir mejorando su negocio comprando tintes, tijeras, esmaltes para uñas y golosinas y así tener que ofrecer a sus distinguidos clientes.
texts.en: Greetings!  Sonia is very responsible, enterprising, and has a desire to improve her and her family’s quality of life.  She started her business, a beauty salon, with her sister.  Over time, and with a lot of effort, they have been able to improve their business by adding sales of beauty products and snacks.  She is happy and appreciates Kiva for helping her make progress.  Her greatest desire is to have her own salon.  She is asking for this loan so that she can continue making improvements and buy tints, scissors, nail polish, and snacks.  In this way she can have a greater variety to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Fausto Willian

texts.es:
Fausto tiene 51 años de edad es de estado civil soltero no tiene hijos vive los hermanos en el Recinto TARIRA perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla RENACER se encuentra ubicada el  recinto TARIRA, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Fausto se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. El crédito le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos y los cultivos. 

El sueño es comprar una casa. En los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Fausto is 51 years old, single, and doesn’t have any children.  He lives with his siblings in the Tarira neighborhood, part of the Centanas settlement of the Los Rios province.  He farms and raises livestock.

Fausto raises corn and rice.  He will use the money from this loan to buy supplies such as fertilizers, compost, and insecticide to prevent blights and disease.  He will make his purchases in Ventanas.  The loan helps him increase his income and improve his crops.

His dream is to buy a house.  He likes to play sports in his spare time.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Kastor Clipso

texts.es:
KASTOR CLIPSO tiene 56 años de edad es casado tine cuatro hijos de 28, 25, 20 y 19 años, vive con la esposa y los hijos en San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar.

KASTOR CLIPSO se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, insecticidas, líquido mata monte. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes que le hacen falta. 

Las compras las realizara en Chimbo. El sueño es ampliar el sembrio. 

Los desafíosa los que se enfrenta es la competencia. En el tiempo libre le gusta compartir en familia.
texts.en:
Kastor Clipso is 56 years old, married, and has four children, ages 28, 25, 20, and 19.  He lives with his wife and children in San Miguel, in the Bolivar province.

Kastor Clipso is a farmer and raises corn.  He is asking for this loan to buy urea, insecticides, and weed killer.  He will also buy fertilizer that he needs.

He will make his purchases in Chimbo.  His dream is to expand his crops.

His challenges are the competition he faces.  He likes to spend time with his family in his spare time.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Gulya

texts.ru: Гуле 39 лет, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей. Двое детей Гули учатся в школе один еще маленький в школу ему еще рано. Гуля в качестве  источника дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении 8 лет занимается  животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS ). Благодаря упорному труду Гули в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 молочные коровы, ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS) от продажи молока и молочных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гуля обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров для откорма и доходов от продажи молочной продукции. Доходы от кредита Гуля планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса посредством постройки сарая для животных.
texts.en: Gulya is 39 years old, is married and is raising 3 children.  Two of Gulya's children attend school, one is still small and is too young for school.  Gulya has been raising livestock for 8 years as a source of income for her family, having started this business with 5,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to Gulya's hard work on her farm, today she has 2 dairy cows; her monthly earnings from her holdings are around 15,000 som (KGS) from the sale of milk and dairy products.  In order to continue growing her business Gulya turned to "Bai Tushum and Partners" for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS) to purchase 2 cows to fatten and for earnings from the sale of dairy products.  Gulya plans to invest the earnings from the loan into growing her business by building a shed for the animals.

loans.use: to purchase two cows

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy embroidery material for her embroidery business

loans.name: Mayerlis

texts.es: Mayerlis a sus 25 años de edad, tiene una pequeña papelería donde vende artículos estudiantiles, como productos de tocador y mercancías variadas, que organiza en su negocio,  de acuerdo con la demanda de cada  temporada. Ella es madre de 1 niña de 4 años y vive con su cónyuge al sur de la ciudad, donde está ubicada su miscelánea desde hace 3 años. Su madre la apoyó para empezar su actividad comercial y es su mejor ejemplo en su tarea diaria, la cual realiza durante 8 horas, todos los días de la semana, generando ingresos que apoyan y beneficien su hogar. Ella vende de contado y a crédito,  trabaja especialmente  sobre pedidos de su clientela. En las épocas como navidades y año nuevo, su miscelánea está adornada con todo lo que impacta a las familias en ese momento, pero también es en este instante en el que  ocurre su mayor desafío, debido a que su capital de trabajo, no es suficiente para responder a  la demanda ocurrida en esta temporada. En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva mediante el cual comprará en un mayor volumen,  parte de los pedidos que han realizado sus clientes, como colonias, cremas, artículos de aseo personal, ropa etc. Su credikiva proyecta ser exitoso pues con él puede comprar en el marco de las solicitudes que ha hecho y esto es lo que a ella mas le gusta, pues con el dinero en sus manos, encuentra las mejores ofertas y con ellas atrae muchos mas compradores. Su meta mas adelante es adquirir una casa y su mayor desafío, es lograr los ahorros suficientes para obtenerla.
texts.en:
Mayerlis, at age 25, has a small store where she sells student supplies, such as desk supplies, and various other items.  She stocks her business based on the season and demand.  She is the mother of a four year old girl and lives with her husband in the south part of the city, where her shop has been located for three years.

Her mother encouraged her to start this business and she is her greatest example for her daily tasks, which she does for eight hours a day, seven days a week, generating income that supports and benefits her home.  She sells for cash and credit and works especially on orders from her customers.  In seasons like Christmas and New Year, her shop is decorated with things that attract families, but it’s also when she has a great challenge, due to her shortage of working capital that does not allow her to respond to her customer demand during the season.

She is asking for a Kiva loan which she will use to buy merchandise in volume.  She will fill her customers’ requests in part with colognes, creams, personal items, clothing, etc.  Her Kiva loan is expected to be a success because she can buy the things that people are asking for and this is what she likes.  With money in hand, she can find better deals and attract more customers.  Her goal is to acquire a house in the future.  Her greatest challenge is not having enough savings.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Jessica Adriana

texts.es:
Jessica tiene 19 años es  estado civil soltera no tiene hijos vive con los padres en casa de ellos en el Recinto TARIRA perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla RENACER se encuentra ubicada el  recinto TARIRA, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Jessica se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. El crédito le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos y los cultivos. 

El sueño es comprar un terreno para seguir sembrando. En los tiempos libres le gusta cuidar de los animales que tiene en la casa como: pollos, cuyes y conejos.
texts.en:
Jessica is 19 years old, single, and lives with her parents in their home in the Tarira neighborhood of the Ventanas settlement of the Los Rios province.

She is farms and raises livestock.

Jessica raises corn and rice.  This loan will allow her to buy supplies such as fertilizer, compost, and insecticides to prevent blights and disease.  She will make her purchases in Ventanas.  The loan helps her to increase her income and her crops.

Her dream is to buy farmland and continue planting.  She likes to care for her animals in her home in her spare time: chickens, Guinea pigs, and rabbits.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Constantina

texts.es:
Constantina, de 58 años, es una mujer sencilla vive en compañía de su esposo. Con quien vive desde hace 40 años, en la casa que compraron hace 30 años.
Juntos forjaron su familia, sus años de esfuerzo y entrega le ayudaron a obtener muchos esfuerzos y logros, tanto así que ahora esperan con tranquilidad la temporada de siembra, pues poseen sus propios terrenos agrícolas. Las cuales comparten con sus hijos. “Ellos también se dedican a la agricultura”, afirma. Ahora se encuentra preparando los terrenos de cultivo, pues comienza la temporada de lluvias por lo que tiene que aprovechar. Pienza sembrar maíz y demás hortalizas, además de forraje y pastos naturales para sus animales. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “pampa blanca” y este es el crédito número 9 con MFP, donde se siente feliz, ya que tiene muchos años trabajando con su asociación, donde los integrantes son personas, humanas y sobre todo con muchas ganas de ayudarse entre ellos. Constantina, invertirá el dinero en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos de maíz.
texts.en:
Constantina, age 58, is a modest woman who lives with her husband. They have been together for 40 years and purchased their house 30 years ago.

After starting their family, Constantina and her husband spent years helping one another and accomplishing many things. Since they have their own farmland that they share with their children, they now wait patiently for the planting season. “My children also engage in farming,” says Constantina. She is now ready to prepare her farmland and will take advantage of the start of the rainy season. Constantina plans to plant corn and other vegetables, as well as fodder and natural grasses for her animals.

She is a member of the Communal Bank “Pampa Blanca” (White Plain) and this will be her ninth loan with MFP. Constantina is happy to have worked with her group for many years and all of the members are humane individuals who have the desire to help one another.

She will invest the money in the purchase of organic compost so that she can fertilize her crops of corn.

loans.use: to buy organic compost.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: Jacinta is taking out a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She runs a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock for her store, such as sleepers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko, and Fanta), and biscuits. She opened her kiosk a years ago with her own capital of $600. She is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy sleepers, cigarettes, soft drinks, and biscuits.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is taking out a loan of $600 to improve her business. She runs a kiosk that helps her generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock for her store, such as sleepers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko, and Fanta), and biscuits. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own capital of $600. She is a hard-working woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy sleepers, cigarettes, soft drinks, and biscuits.

loans.name: Elda

texts.en: Elda is applying for a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is running a business in front of her house selling palm wine. She is making a good income from selling palm wine and she wants to buy more stock with the loan. She lives in a town near the main road, so many people come to buy, and she is selling every day. She started her business a year ago with her own capital.

loans.use: to buy palm wine for resale.

loans.name: Tamara Bebsabe

texts.es:
Tamara, 23 años de edad, originaria de Pueblo Nuevo,  Estelí, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropa y juguetes. Ella  inicio con capital propio, vendiendo juguetes  de forma ambulante a sus amigos que le hacían encargo, luego con el tiempo le fue gustando este negocio y decidió establecer su propio negocio en su casa,  cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien le ayuda económicamente, este ha sido su primer negocio, sus expectativas es establecer una tienda bien surtido de productos variado.
 En esta ocasión esta  solicitando el financiamiento para comprar  mas mercadería en general como, blusas, pantalones, faldas, juguetes, zapatos, etc.  Todos los productos necesarios para surtir aun más el inventario de su negocio. El estima que este préstamo le será de gran ayuda ya que aumentaran sus ventas generándole más ganancias que  invertirá en su negocio y en la mejora de su vivienda. Sus planes futuros es ampliar más su negocio hasta convertirlo en una tienda que vende al por mayor mercadería variada para tener un negocio estable que le genere  mejores ingresos y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Tamara is 23 years old and from Pueblo Nuevo, Estelí.  She sells clothing and toys and began with her own capital, selling toys on foot to her friends who made requests, then in time she liked the business more and decided to set up her own home based store.  Her husband supports this and he helps her financially.  This was her first business and she wants to have a well-stocked store with a variety of products.

Tamara is asking for a loan to buy merchandise in general, such as blouses, pants, skirts, toys, and shoes.  She needs all these products to stock her store and feels that this loan will be of great help and that her sales and income will increase.  She will also be able to make improvements to her home.  Her plans for the future are to sell a greater variety of merchandise and have a stable business that will provide better income so she can get ahead with her family.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en: Raquel is married and has four children. She is 41 years old. She lives in Bocator, Tangub City. Raquel owns and operates a general store to earn a living. She's been in this business for three years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP with this business. She has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy new items such as candies, milo (a brand of malted milk), shampoo, soap, etc. In 2011, Raquel joined GDMPC. In the future, Raquel hopes to expand and improve the business.

loans.use: to buy new items such as candies, milo (a brand of malted milk), shampoo, soap, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy beads, thread, etc. for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Freydell Massiel

texts.es:
Freydell tiene 23 años de edad, originario de Estelí, soltero, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la costura, desde hace 5 años, negocio donde ha tenido experiencia y total dominio. Inicio su actividad debido a que su mama se dedicaba a la costura y luego se lo dejo a ella como herencia y fue allí que busco como sacar otro curso para especializarse un poco mas en la costura, este ha sido su único negocio, sus expectativa es poder hacer una línea de ropa de marca para satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela.
Solicita el crédito para comprar una maquina de coser y telas para la elaboración de sus trajes que le encargan sus clientes. Este crédito será de ayuda ya que podrá darle mantenimiento a sus maquinas para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, sus planes futuros es  hacer ropa de marca, para ofrecer un servicio mejor  y remodelar el local  para una mejor presentación del negocio, su meta próxima  es llegar a tener su casa propia para evitar los gastos de estar alquilando y asi tener un negocio fijo que le genere mas ingresos para poder salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Freydell is 23 years old and from Estelí.  She is single and has been a seamstress for five years.  She had experience and became an expert in this business.  She started because her mother was a seamstress and taught her, but then she looked for a course so that she could specialize a bit.  This has been her only business and her hopes are to be able to create her own line of clothing to satisfy her customers’ needs.

She is asking for this loan to buy a sewing machine and fabric to make outfits that her customers have ordered.  This loan will be of great help because she will also be able to do maintenance on her machines so that she can better serve her customers.  Her future plans are to have her own brand of clothing, to provide better service, and remodel her shop so that she can improve her presentation.  Her next goal is to have a home of her own so that she doesn’t have to pay rent and she can have a fixed business that will generate more income so that she can get ahead with her family.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan compró víveres para su negocio en mayor cantidad y rotó su mercancía rápidamente, con ello generó más posibilidades de compra y de obtener utilidades, y esto fue gracias a su credikiva. Hoy se prepara para recibir las navidades y la noche buena, por eso está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento, con el cual comprará más mercancías, ampliará la infraestructura de su local para que sus clientes se encuentren más cómodos y tengan muchos productos de donde escoger. Él está muy agradecido y dice a sus financiadores que “gracias a esta oportunidad que le dieron, el negocio ha prosperado más, tiene más mercancías y compró otro estante para organizar sus productos. “
texts.en: Juan bought food in quantity for his business and quickly sold out.  He was able to generate more possibilities for purchasing.  This was thanks to his Kiva loan.  How he is preparing for the holiday season and Christmas Eve, so he is requesting another loan that he will use to buy merchandise and expand his shop’s infrastructure so that his customers are more comfortable and can have many products to choose from.  He is very grateful and says, “Thank you for this opportunity.  The business has prospered more and he has many items and also bought a display case to better organize his products.”

loans.use: to update the premises and to buy merchandise for the end of the year season.

loans.name: Delma

texts.en: Delma, 60, is a widow from Santa Cruz, Tangub City. To make a living, she runs a general store. Delma been running her business for six years and earns 8,000 PHP a month from these activities. Delma is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee. In 2011, Delma joined GDMPC. She plans to save the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee.

loans.name: Rosa Del Carmen

texts.es: Rosa multiplicó la inversión de su credikiva, porque pudo pagar facturas y compró mercancia a un buen precio porque lo hizo de contado. Ella está preparandose para las navidades y el año nuevo y por eso aplica a un nuevo creidkiva, porque su capital de trabajo se vuelve un desafio debido a que sus pedidos son superiores que lo usual. Con su credikiva comprará articulos y mercancias variadas en el marco de las solicitudes de pedidos que han hecho a ella su clientela. Rosa Dice a sus financiadores de Kiva: "Gracias Dios los bendiga porque están haciendo una obra muy buena conmigo y con otras personas.
texts.en: Rosa multiplied her Kiva loan because she was able to pay invoices for merchandise she bought at a good price because she paid in cash.  She is preparing for the holiday season and New Year and is asking for a new Kiva loan because her lack of working capital is a challenge; her customer requests are greater than usual.  She will use the money to buy various types of merchandise to fill her customers’ requests.  Rosa says to her Kiva lenders, “Thank you and may God bless you, for you are doing good work with me and other persons.”

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es: Nuevamente el señor Rafael acude a su creidkiva, porque se acercan las navidades y el año nuevo, donde debe aprovechar para vender sus productos; él comprará con su nuevo credikiva cervezas por cajas, gaseosas, principalmente, pues su clientela bailará al son de la musica del caribe y estará feliz con su familia bebiendo refrescos y cervezas y comiendo todo lo que les guste y así recibirán su año nuevo 2013
texts.en: Rafael is asking for a new Kiva loan because the Christmas and New Year season is approaching and he wants to take advantage of it to sell his products.  He will use the money to buy cases of beer and soft drinks.  His customers will dance to Caribbean music and be happy with their families while they drink soft drinks and beer as they receive the New Year, 2013.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and beer.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cooking oil, snacks, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en: Hazel, 28, is a single woman who lives in Sta. Maria, Tangub City. Hazel owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns PHP 8,000 from her business. She has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy more stock, such as eggs, noodles, shampoo, soap, and toothpaste. In 2011, Hazel joined GDMPC. In the future, Hazel wants to save a reserve for emergencies.

loans.use: to buy more items such as eggs, noodles, shampoo, soap, and toothpaste.

loans.name: Priscila Maribel

texts.es:
Priscila, se dedica a la venta pollo fresco y carne, vive con su esposo los dos trabajan para poder cubrir las necesidades del hogar, tiene una hija y nietos, ayuda a sus nietos a estudiar, el negocio de Priscila está ubicado en el mercado realiza la venta todos los días de la semana y con la ayuda de una empleada, tiene una experiencia de más de 20 años.

Solicita un préstamo para comprar productos frescos para la venta por ejemplo pollo, cajas de alitas, carne de res, condimentos, entre otros productos que son necesarias y que le ayudarán en esta temporada navideña, este crédito le ayudará para fortalecer el negocio y poder acoger más clientes en estas fechas importantes.

El sueño de ella es tener siempre el negocio del cual ayuda a los nietos, ya que son de escasos recursos y con este aporte logrará trabajar por su familia.
texts.en:
Priscila sells fresh chicken and beef.  She lives with her husband and they both work to cover the household needs.  She has a daughter and she helps provide for her grandchildren’s educations.  Priscila’s business is located in the market and she makes sells every day of the week with the help of an employee.  She has more than 20 years’ experience.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy fresh products, such as chicken, cases of wings, beef, condiments, and other things that will help her during this Christmas season.  This loan will help her strengthen her business and attract more customers during these important dates.
 
Her dream is to always have a business that will help her grandchildren because they are of limited resources and she wants to be able to work to help her family.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Ganzorig

texts.en: Mr. Ganzorig is 43 years old and lives with his wife and four children in a small house in the Hentii province of Mongolia. His wife, Altansuvd, is planning to start her own business of building block manufacture next spring when the weather becomes little warmer. His three sons, Tojil, Tsend, and Sumiya, go to the local secondary school, and his daughter, Misheel, goes to the local kindergarten. He has been running a taxi service business for years now. He just bought a small house for the family because it was harder to live in a ger with their four children, especially since their sons have grown bigger. He is now requesting MNT 5,000,000 to buy construction materials, vacuum windows, and a new floor heating system to insulate the house and stay warm in the winter. He is a hardworking, responsible, and friendly person.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, vacuum windows, and a new floor heating system to insulate the house and stay warm during winters.

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
This is Anabelle. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used to buy more fruits. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a new 50,000 PHP loan to purchase more fruits needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. She also sells charcoal for additional income.

Anabelle dreams to have an apartment for rent and hopes to have a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more fruits for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy candies and toffees to sell to stores.

loans.name: Myanganbayar

texts.en:
Mr. Myanganbayar is 27 years old. He lives with his wife and father in a rental apartment in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife Tomor-Ochir runs her own small clothing retail business at a rented counter in the local market with her sister. His father has been working at state-owned organization for years now. Myanganbayar is a hairdresser and works at a barber shop. He is attending a language course and needs to exchange his old personal computer for a laptop computer that he can carry around to increase his efficiency. He is now requesting MNT 2,000,000 to buy a new laptop computer to support his education. He is an open-minded, hardworking, and neat man.

This picture of the borrower was taken at his wife's clothing retail counter.

loans.use: to buy a laptop computer to support his education.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
This is Rosalinda, 48, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Marvin who works abroad and she is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rosalinda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 40,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Rosalinda wants a good life for her children. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Emilio Jr.

texts.en: Emilio, separated, is from Dimalco, Bonifacio. At age 59, he still continues to manage his transport service business. It has been operating for almost 14 years now and he earns 3,000 PHP a month. To improve business, he borrowed 5,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit, which he just joined recently, to obtain accessories and tires. He’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding his business before long..

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires

loans.name: Renalyn

texts.en: Renalyn is married with two children. She is 28 years old, and resides at Kapalaran, Tambulig. Renalyn owns and operates a farm, planting & harvesting rice for sale to earn a living. She's been in this business for 19 years.. Each month, she earns 7,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. In 2010, Renalyn joined GDMPC. In the future, Renalyn wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials to renovate and insulate her house

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy embriodery materials

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
This is Roberto. He previously accessed an 11,000 PHP loan that he utilized to purchase farm inputs needed in his business. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. He also sells pork per kilo for additional income.

He would like to apply for another loan of 16,000 PHP.  He will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizer, seeds and other tools for maintenance of the farm. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. 

Roberto dreams that his children will finish their studies and hopes to have a good life with his family. As a CCT community partner, Roberto faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week, where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for farming materials and other supplies needed in his business.

loans.name: Glecy

texts.en:
Glecy has previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts and accessories and to pay for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to pay for spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Glecy hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of giving her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle unit

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.fr: jacqueline est une femme de 47 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont le premier a 26 ans et le dernier 18 ans. Restauratrice depuis 25 ans, elle vend des beignets dans un coin de la ville. Femme batante et courageuse qui sponsorise ses enfants, elle sollicite le crédit pour acheter des matières premières (farine, haricot, maïs, accessoires du breakfast)pour augmenter son niveau de stock qui est moyen et afin d'accroître son chiffre d'affaires ainsi que son profit. le profit dégagé sera utilisé pour réinvestir dans son activité et le reste pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa famille (éducation de ses enfants, nutrition et santé)
texts.en:
Jacqueline is 47 years old, married, and the mother of five children between the ages of 26 and 18.  She has been involved in the preparation of meals for the past 25 years, selling fritters locally, in her town.

Jacqueline is a dynamic and courageous woman who financially supports her children.  She is requesting this loan to buy food supplies (flour, beans, maize and breakfast foods), in order to increase the level of her stock, which is not very high.  This loan will also help her to increase her turnover and profits. 

Jacqueline will reinvest her profits in her activity and use the rest of the money to meet her family's needs (children's education, nutritional and healthcare needs).

loans.use: to buy supplies such as flour, beans, maize and breakfast foods.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda has run a general store to earn a living for two years. She is aged 43 and is married, and lives in Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP from doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy more items such as eggs, noodles, shampoo, soap and toothpaste. In 2010, Merlinda joined GDMPC. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items such as eggs, noodles, shampoo, soap and toothpaste.

loans.name: Digna

texts.en:
Digna is a 54-year-old married woman from Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in a mat-weaving business for more than 20 years. This is the source of her income. Digna works hard to support her husband in meeting their family's needs. 

She is requesting a loan to buy materials like Romblon (pine) leaves, coloring, straw,  etc. for mat weaving. With this, she will be able to make and weave more mats. In the future, Digna hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy materials like Romblon (pine) leaves, coloring, straw, etc. for mat weaving

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Roger is a 38-year-old married man, the father of five children and is from Ubay, Bohol.  Roger has been engaged in a tricycle and motorcycle transport business for more than three years now.  He transports passengers from one place to another especially in remote areas. 

Roger is asking for a loan to buy spare parts like wheel tires, nuts and bolts, etc. for his motorcycle. With this loan, he will be able to maintain his vehicle's good working condition. In the future, Roger hopes to make his business a success and to save money for his children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy spare parts like wheel tires, nuts and bolts, etc. for his motorcycle

loans.name: Nodar

texts.en:
Nodar is 46 years old. He lives in Lanchkhuti District with his wife, two sons and a daughter-in-law.  The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have three milk cows and three calves. In addition, they have a plot of land where maize and potatoes are grown. They sell the harvested products locally in an open market at a good price. 

With the received credit, Nodar will purchase building materials and build a new shed as the existing shed was too small and has been destroyed. After building the new shed, they will be able to expand their dairy farm and produce more dairy products in future. This will increase the family's income. With increased income, the family's living conditions will significantly improve. Nodar awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy building materials and build a new shed for his cattle

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan earns a living through her sari-sari (variety) store business. She sells various goods and commodities to the people in her community in Bohol, Philippines. 

Susan is asking for a loan to buy merchandise  like canned goods, noodles, sugar, chips and snack foods, soap and toiletries, etc. to sell in her store. With this increased merchandise, she will be able to attract and cater for more customers and buyers. In the future, Susan hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, sugar, chips and snack foods, soap and toiletries, etc. to sell in her store

loans.name: Lewelyn

texts.en:
Lewelyn previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she utilized to buy fertilizers, seeds and other tools for the maintenance of her farm. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures. She works hard to continually expand her business and to establish more business in the future. 

Lewelyn would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy farming materials and supplies. Her profits from her business will definitely help her sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Lewelyn wants to expand her business and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for farming materials and supplies

loans.name: Vicent Cyril

texts.en:
Vicent Cyril, aged 40, is a widower from Digson, Bonifacio  who has three children. He is an entrepreneur and earns income from his transport service business. Vicent Cyril started  his business almost two years ago and he earns 10,000 PHP a month. 

To improve his business, he is borrowing 25,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit which he joined recently. He will use the loan to buy motorcycle accessories and tires. Vicent Cyril is hopeful of the possibility of expanding his business before long.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle accessories and tires.

loans.name: Sawa Ya Kola Group

texts.en:
Hope, aged 29, is a married woman  who has three children and a dependant who is an orphan. She is very hard-working and social. She sells foodstuffs like Irish potatoes and plantains which are delicacies for most people especially for the middle class in the city. 

Hope operates her business in a busy market making high daily sales. With the profits, she is educating her children as well as the orphan in her care. In future, with increased income, Hope will begin another business to supplement the existing one. Her major challenges are stiff competition, limited capital and unfaithful debtors. Hope is the one kneeling on the left.

loans.use: to buy food items to sell

loans.name: Odiljon

texts.ru: Одилджон проживает в районе Кумсангир. Он женат. Ему 35 лет. Одилджон живет с женой. Его жена занимается домашним хозяйством, а также она на грядке выращивает овощи. Одилджон добропорядочный человек. Он хочет заняться своим делом, зарабатывать и обеспечивать семью. Одилджон берет кредит для закупа крупнорогатого скота (именно бычков). Таким образом, он намерен начать свое дело. Одилджон будет разводить скот у себя дома.
texts.en: Odiljon lives in the Qumsangir region.  He is married, 35 years old and he lives with his wife, who works as a homemaker and also raises vegetables in the garden.  Odiljon is a respectable person; he wants to go about his business to work and support of his family.  He is asking for a loan to buy large livestock (specifically bulls), as he intends to start a business raising livestock at his home.

loans.use: to buy bulls.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy garbage cans for a garbage can-selling business

loans.name: Alijon

texts.ru: Алижон проживает в районе Кумсангир. Ему 28 лет. Он женат. У него один ребенок. Алижон занимается посевом сельскохозяйственных культур. Этим видом деятельности он занимается восемь лет. Алижон берет кредит для посева озимой пшеницы.
texts.en: Alijon lives in the Qumsangir region.  He is 28 years old and is married with one child.  Alijon is an agricultural worker and he has been in this line of work for eight years.  He is asking for a loan so he can plant his winter wheat.

loans.use: to buy seeds

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.ru: Назокат жительница района Пяндж. Ей 28 лет. Назокат замужем. У нее один ребенок. Ее муж находится на заработках за рубежом. Назокат портниха, она шьет национальные платья. Этим видом деятельности Назокат занимается два года. Она берет кредит для приобретения модернизированной швейной машинки.
texts.en: Nazokat lives in the Pyandj region.  She is 28 years old and is married with one child.  Her husband is a migrant worker abroad.  Nazokat is a seamstress; she sews national dresses.  She has been in this line of work for two years.  She is asking for a loan to buy a modern sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a modern sewing machine

loans.name: Jamilamo

texts.ru: Чамиламо живет в городе Куляб. Ей 39 лет. Она замужем, имеет 5 детей. Муж Чамиламо госслужащий. Ее дети учатся в школе. Образование у Чамиламо высшее, она учитель. По специальности Чамиламо работает пятнадцать лет. По вечерам она занимается шитьем. В этой области Чамиламо имеет богатый опыт. Она более семнадцати лет занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Чамиламо берет кредит для покупки швейной машинки.
texts.en: Jamilamo lives in the city of Kulob.  She is 39 years old and is married with five children.  Her husband is a civil servant and her children are in school.  Jamilamo has a higher education; she is a teacher, a specialty in which she has been working for 15 years.  She sews in the evenings and she has a lot of experience in this area.  She has been sewing national dresses for more than 17 years.  Jamilamo is asking for a loan to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Abdulmumin

texts.ru: Абдулмумин живет в городе Куляб. Ему 26 лет. Он холост. Абдулмумин арендует помещение, где занимается очисткой хлопка. Этим видом деятельности он занимается год. Абдулмумин берет кредит для приобретения оборудования для выжимания масла. Он хочет продолжить свою деятельность, а также заняться производством хлопкового масла.
texts.en: Abdulmumin lives in the city of Kulob.  He is 26 years old and single.  He rents a space where he works in cotton ginning.  He has been in this line of work for a year.  Abdulmunin is asking for a loan to buy an oil pressing machine.  He wants to continue in his business and also to produce cottonseed oil.

loans.use: to buy equipment for pressing oil

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy two sacks of beans, potatoes, oil, Fanta, Primus, etc.

loans.name: Ziyoda

texts.ru: Зиёда трудолюбивая и добрая женщина. Ей 37 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Мать Зиёды живет вместе с ними.
