This communal bank is called "Somos 15", and is formed of fifteen entrepreneurs who make a living in different fields of work, like crafts, bazaars, selling fast food, selling toys, selling perfumes, selling various decorations, and services, among others.  All of the members live in the city of San Antonio.  

Eileen is a member of the communal bank.  She is the one in the back of the photo, in the pink blouse and sunglasses.  Her hair is dark brown and she wears it down.  Her group members are all pointing to her.

She makes a living in her bazaar.  She has been doing this for six months.  She says that she has a bazaar near her house and works every day.  Her schedule depends on her availability.  She offers a variety of items, like toys, things for the house, photo-printed bowls, and photos requested by the customer.

She buys the merchandise and materials that she needs in the city of Santiago in different commercial shops; some specialize in selling photographic items at low costs, which is more economically convenient.

With the loan, she will buy bowls, ceramics, and toys. 

One of Eileen's goals is to continue with her business, growing day by day and being able to increase her merchandise in order to satisfy the needs of her customers.  In this, she will be able to aim for a better quality of life.  

Eileen lives with her parents, sister, and niece.  Her personal dream is to grow as a micro-entrepreneur; her family dream is to have a good income in order to give the best to her family.  

She is very thankful and happy with this opportunity offered through Fondo Esperanza, which will allow her to invest in her business.  She says that the training sessions have been fundamental to her business and also to her personal development.  She has already learned to organize and distribute her income and investments in the best way.  

San Antonio is a port to the Valparaíso region; this is one of its main characteristics.  It is located on the central coast of Chile.  It developed through the important fishing trade, through the sale of fish and seafood.  Despite the port activity and trade, there is a high rate of unemployment.

loans.use: to buy bowls, ceramics, and toys.

loans.name: Stalin Martin

texts.es:
Stalin es de estado civil soltero no tiene hijos vive con la madre en el Recinto TARIRA perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla RENACER se encuentra ubicada el  recinto TARIRA, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Stalin se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. El crédito le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos y los cultivos. 

El sueño es comprar un carro para el trabajo. En los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Stalin is single and does not have children.  He lives with his mother in the neighborhood of Tarira which is part of the Cantón Ventanas province of Los 
Ríos.  He belongs to the communal bank RENACER, which is also located in Tarira in Cantón Ventanas.  He works in agriculture and livestock.

Stalin has been working in agriculture and the planting of corn and rice.  With this loan he will be able to buy products like fertilizers and insecticides in order to avoid the plagues and sicknesses that affect crops.  He makes his purchases in the city of Ventanas.  The loan will help him increase his income and his crops.  

His dream is to purchase a car for work.  In his free time he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and insecticides in order to avoid the plagues and sicknesses that affect crops.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan, 34 years old, is married and has two children. He has worked as a taxi driver for 13 years. Hassan is a Palestinian refugee who works hard to provide his family with the best life, especially as they live in a Palestinian camp, which he hopes to be able to afford to leave one day.

Hassan is applying for his first loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to perform necessary maintenance on his rented car because it is his only source of income. Hassan is very excited for this loan since Al Majmoua is the only Lebanese NGO who supports the Palestinian refugees and because he has to make sure to keep his business going. Hassan can't afford to buy a car of his own, so he has to take good car of the available one. He hopes to buy his own car and a public driving plate in the future.

loans.use: To do the necessary maintenance on his rented vehicle

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy furniture for her teaching academy

loans.name: Roger

texts.en: Roger's main source of income comes from his palay (rice) production business. He is 52 years old, married, and has 2 kids. He is from Lilo-an, Bonifacio, and has been farming for 3 years, earning an amount of about 10,000 PHP a month. Recently, Roger joined GDMPC. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next crop. Roger plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next crop.

loans.name: Marcos Jacinto

texts.es:
Marcos tiene 23 años de edad es de estado civil soltero no tiene hijos vive con los padres en el Recinto TARIRA perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla RENACER se encuentra ubicada el  recinto TARIRA, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Marcos se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. El crédito le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos y los cultivos. 

El sueño es comprar un carro para el trabajo. En los tiempos libres le gusta jugar pelota.
texts.en:
Marcos is 23 years old and single. He does not have any children. He lives with his parents in the rural settlement of Tarira, part of Ventanas canton in Los Ríos province. He is a member of the RENACER communal bank, which is located in Tarira, Ventanas canton and loans to agricultural workers.

Marcos works growing corn and rice. With the loan he will buy supplies such as fertilizers, manure, and insecticides to prevent plagues and diseases. He will make his purchases in Ventanas city. The loan will help him to increase his earnings and his crops. 

His dream is to buy a car for work. In his free time, he likes to play soccer.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, manure, and insecticides for his crops.

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia is 37 years old and a very hardworking and independent woman. She is living in Punjab, Pakistan, with her husband, daughter and son. Both of the children are students. Her husband is a painter and his income is insufficient to meet the household expenses. 

Shazia owns a small beauty salon at her home. Through her small business, she is trying to help her husband to meet the household expenses. She is an efficient and responsible beautician. Currently she is in need of purchasing a variety of cosmetic and beauty products, like straightener, make up kits, facial creams, etc., but due to the lack of finances and savings she can't purchase them.

For that reason, Shazia, as a member of a six-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. On getting a profit, first of all she will repay the loan amount to Kiva and then she wants to build a new room in the salon, as the space in the salon is much too congested. She hopes that her business grows more. She is very much thankful to both Brac Pakistan and Kiva. 

Note: In the picture, Shazia is carrying a passbook in her hand.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of beauty and cosmetic products for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and hire a worker for her husband's tailoring business.

loans.name: Roland

texts.en:
Roland lives in the Sagarejo District of East Georgia with his wife and their three children.

To earn a living, Roland works as a driver. He has his own mini-bus, and his monthly salary is the sole source of his family's income.

Roland has requested a loan to start a trading business. His loan would be through a new joint initiative by Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages providing start-up and restart-up capital, with lenient conditions, to the country's rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. Such individuals are often regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income.

Roland will use the loan proceeds to purchase fruits and vegetables from farmers at wholesale prices, and he will later sell such fruits and vegetables in nearby towns for a profit. He expects that the loan proceeds will allow him to increase his family's income and will thereby enable him to improve their living conditions. Moreover, in the future, the family should have enough income to access regular credit products available in the country’s capital market.

loans.use: to start a new trading business by purchasing fruits and vegetables for re-sale purposes

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en: Dioscora is a 34-year-old farmer from Ubay, Bohol. She has been in a rice farming business together with her husband for several years now. This is the source of their income. Dioscora is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, they will be able to grow and produce a good harvest. In the future, Dioscora aims to make their farming business a success.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Dario

texts.en:
Dario is a 65-year-old married man and a father of seven grown up children from Ubay, Bohol. He has operated a sari-sari or variety store business for more than four years now. This is the source of his income. 

He is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell in his store, like canned goods, noodles, candies, biscuits, chips and snack foods, beverages, soap and toiletries. With this, he will be able to attract and cater to more buyers in his store, thus increasing his sales and profit. In the future, Dario hopes of making his business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in his store like canned goods, noodles, candies, biscuits, chips and snack foods, beverages, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Azhar

texts.en:
Azhar is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo, taken inside the store. Azhar is a 36-year-old married woman - a housewife and a mother to two sons and two daughters. Her husband is employed and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover all the family's needs.

For the past one and a half years, Azhar's husband has had a grocery store, selling different types of groceries. It has been a profitable project and a second source of income for the family, but also it needs more support to cover the costs.

Azhar wants to support her husband to improve the family's project, so she is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of purchasing needed stock of basic groceries that customers often request, such as rice, sugar and dairy products. This will increase sales and increase the family's income, so they could live in better conditions.

loans.use: To purchase needed stock of basic groceries.

loans.name: Zolzaya

texts.en:
Mrs. Zolzaya is 28 years old and lives with her husband and their two children in Ger, which is in the Suhbaatar district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband works for a private company as a driver. Her son, Norovbadam, is eight years old and attends a primary school, while her daughter, Azjargal, is a one-year-old who stays at home.

Since 2005, she has been working for her sister at the rental counter of a local market. She explains that she is a hardworking and optimistic person.

She is now planning to start her own retail clothing business in the same market. As a result, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,800,000 MNT to purchase some initial inventory for her retail business.

loans.use: to start a retail business by purchasing clothing inventory

loans.name: Mher

texts.en:
Mher is 31 years old and lives with his father and grandmother. The family is involved in agriculture. They keep 4 pigs, 16 little pigs and 250 chickens. Mher grows and fattens the pigs, and then with the help of his father sells them at higher prices. The family has 12 years of experience in the agricultural field and this is their only source of income. 

Mher has applied for this loan to improve his livestock with special milk cows. He will use the milk in cheese production and will sell it in the local markets. The other part of the loan will be spent on purchasing barley seeds. Mher is a hardworking person and he will do his best to gather a good harvest. This will enable him to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for 2 cows, 13 pigs and barley seeds.

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en:
Lusine lives in Goris with her husband, their two children, and her mother-in-law.

To earn a living, she is a teacher at a local school. Together with her family, Lusine also runs a farm. Currently, her farm has apple, pear, plum, and apricot trees. Lusine's school salary is only enough to cover the family's basic needs, so the agriculture business helps to provide an additional stable income stream.

Lusine has applied for this loan to renovate the greenhouse, which would allow her to cultivate vegetables and fruits and which she feels should enable her to significantly increase their income. The loan is important for Lusine because she expects it can help her generate more income and thereby ensure better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to expand and improve her agriculture business by renovating her greenhouse

loans.name: Busamba 11. Yahura Yohoza Tweimukye Group

texts.en:
Jane is a 38-year-old hardworking woman living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She used her previous loan to buy general merchandise to sell. Jane has been operating a retail shop after getting start up capital from her family. Her main hardship is inadequate capital to purchase stock. However, she has a vision of diversifying her business to include farming. Jane has a personal goal of building a permanent home.

Jane intends to use this loan to buy general merchandise, such as soap and sugar, to sell. She is a member of the above-mentioned group, whose members guarantee each other in accessing a loan. Some of the members did not take out a loan but had to abide by the policy. Jane is is the third from the left in the photo.

loans.use: to buy general merchadise

loans.name: Kirangara Group

texts.en: Richard used the previous loan to buy land and tomatoes to sell. He is a 24-year-old hard-working man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He lives in his own home in Fort Portal. He grows tomatoes to earn a living. With the credit facilities, he has been able to pay school fees for his children. He is a member of the above mentioned group, and his desire is to own at least ten acres of tomato gardens in the next two years. Richard intends to use the loan to buy tomato seedlings for planting.

loans.use: to buy land and plant tomatoes

loans.name: Gerelt-Od

texts.en:
Gerelt-Od is 31 years old. He lives with his wife and two children in Ger, in the Niseh district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife, Byambasuren, age 29, works as a cashier in a cafeteria. His daughter, Davaajargal, age 13, goes to a local school and his son, Davaabaatar, age 2, goes to a local kindergarten. 

Gerelt-Od has been breeding cattle for years. He has 37 cattle, including baby cows, and he sells his organic dairy products to local customers and other retailers. 

Gerelt-Od is now requesting MNT 4,000,000 to purchase forage and other vitalized food for his cattle. Gerelt is a hard-working, diligent, and honest man.

loans.use: to purchase forage and other vitalized food for his cattle.

loans.name: Eduardo Rafael

texts.es: Eduardo en su fabrica de calzado le está yendo muy bien y esto es gracias a su credikiva, combinado con su capacidad de trabajo, pues al acceder a un préstamo lo invirtió en la compra de materiales, como cueros, suelas pegantes e inusmos, ganando descuentos y fabricando nuevos diseños que fueron vendidos muy pronto. El aumento de su prodcción ayuda a una mejor conviviencia pues los sueños familiares se ven rteflejados en beneficios para el bienestar del hogar. El dice a sus financiadores que sigan ayudando a los microempresarios colombianos, para que puedan cumplir las metas y esto es lo que Eduardo lo agradece mucho. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva nuevamente, con el cual comprará una vitrina, para hacer la exhibición de nuevos diseños decembrinos, y materiales como cuero, cuerina, pegante etc. La calidad con la que fabrica el calzado, que van de acuerdo a cada temporada es lo que hace que la inversión de su credikiva en el taller de Eduardo tenga mucho éxito para él y su familia y hará que pasen una navidad feliz y tengan muchas metas para que su año nuevo 2013 sea próspero.
texts.en: Eduardo is a cobbler and it is going well and this is thanks to his Kiva credit, combined with his capacity for work.  Upon accessing a loan he invested it in the purchase of materials like leather, soles and other materials.  He was able to get discounts and fabricate new designs that were sold very quickly.  The increase in his production helps improve his life and the dreams of his family.  These improvements are reflected in the well-being of his family.  He says to his financiers (Kiva lenders) that they should continue to help the small Colombian micro-businesses, so that they can meet their goals.  That is what Eduardo is grateful for.  Currently he is applying for a new Kiva loan with which he will purchase a display case in order to show off his new December designs, as well as to purchase material like leather, vinyl, glue, etc.  The quality with which he makes the shoes, which changes according to the season, is what makes the investment of Kiva credit so successful for Eduardo's shop.  Eduardo has plans for great success for him and his family and the loan will allow him and his family to have a happy Christmas season and to make many goals so that his 2013 new year will be prosperous.

loans.use: to purchase material like leather, vinyl, glue, etc.

loans.name: Zolboo

texts.en:
Mrs. Zolboo is 24 years old and lives with her husband and newborn baby son in a ger (traditional Mongolian tent) in the Govisumber province of Mongolia. Her husband, Gantulga, age 23, works part-time at a private mining company. Her son, Gandol, is 4 months old and Zolboo's mother babysits her son during the day. 

Zolboo has been working as a saleswoman in the local market for several years and obtained lot of experience in the clothing retail business, and is now planning to start her own clothes retail shop in the local market. Since the baby was born, the family expenses have increased noticeably. She is now requesting 530,000 MNT to purchase her starting inventory for her newly started clothes retail business. She is a hardworking, honest and responsible woman.

loans.use: to purchase her starting inventory for her newly started clothes retail business.

loans.name: Srou's Group

texts.en:
Srou is a 37-year-old, married woman residing in a rural village of the Sa Ang district, which is located in Cambodia’s Kandal province. She and her husband have three children, who are either students or employed.

To earn a living, Srou and her husband work as rice farmers. To add more income to the family, Srou also works at a garment factory. Together, this hard-working couple typically earns approximately 10,000 KHR per day. However, after taking into account their daily expenses, they are only able to save approximately 2,000 KHR per day.

Srou is leading a loan group consisting of three female members, all of whom are first-time borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). They are seeking a loan in the amount of 150,000 KHR each. As the group's leader, Srou plans on utilizing her portion of the loan proceeds to build a latrine for her family's use. Once a working latrine is properly installed, Srou and her family will be able to avoid unsanitary practices and as a result will be much healthier in the future.

loans.use: To improve her family's living conditions by building and installing a latrine

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy an auto rickshaw body for her husband's transport business.

loans.name: Hiyam

texts.en:
Hiyam is a 47-year-old married woman and the mother of six children. 

She has been selling clothes for nine years to help her husband in making their living and responding to almost all of their customers' needs. Hiyam is a hard worker who puts so much effort in responding to customers' needs and requests to keep them pleased in a very special way.

Hiyam is applying for her first loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to expand her workplace with extra shelves and aluminum displays, in addition to a special New Year clothes collection. She is very excited for this loan because she always dreamed of doing such changes but she couldn't afford saving for such things.

Hiyam is planning to expand her work more and more through increasing the variety of products available.

loans.use: To expand her workplace with extra shelves and aluminum displays in addition to a special New Year clothes collection

loans.name: Mariama J.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust is very pleases to present to you this group of teachers from one of the schools in Kenema city, in eastern Sierra Leone. 

This group of teachers, like their colleague teachers in other SMT operational areas comes to SMT to request for loans. With the help of these loans, they can meet their immediate financial challenges, and at the end of each month they repay the loan using their monthly salaries. 

Adonis is the featured leader of this group of borrowers. The 50-year-old is a native of Manowa, in eastern Sierra Leone. He is married to a trader and the couple has six children who are attending secondary schools and tertiary educational institutions. Adonis is a teacher who has served in the teaching profession for 28 years now. 

He has requested for this loan in order to buy house building materials such as cement, iron corrugated zinc, sand, nails, rods, etc., for the construction of a family dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement, iron corrugated zinc, sand, nails, rods, etc., for the construction of a family dwelling house

loans.name: Kelita

texts.es:
Kelita, de 54 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y decidida, además de ser alegre y amable. Es conviviente con Ángel, quien es albañil pesada y es padre de sus hijos quienes ya son mayores de edad de edad y son independientes. Juntos habitan cómodamente en su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Kelita es la venta de zapatos para damas, caballeros y niños de diversos modelos. Que son adquiridos en la ciudad de Lima, gracias al apoyo de su amiga quien vive allá, es quien realiza las compras y se las envía, y luego Kelita las vende entre sus familiares, amistades y vecinos, a quienes atiende de manera amable, logrando ganarse su preferencia.
 Tiene más de 10 años dedicándose a éste negocio, y hasta el momento lo realiza sola.
Le gusta su negocio pues le genera un ingreso económico y tener una ocupación, además de estar en casa y el tiempo libre que lo emplea en le cuidado de sus animales (pollos y patos). Considera su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias  que le deja, y por tanto desea aumentar su stock de mercaderías y lograr hacer crecer su negocio. Por otro lado, comenta que tiene conocimientos en costura, teniendo planes de comprarse una maquina de coser e incursionar en este negocio, de esa manera generarse más ingresos económicos. Por tanto éste será el préstamo número 12 con la institución MFP. Está muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado se siente a gusto con su banco comunal, pues  considera un grupo unido y solidario.
Con e l monto solicitado de 1200 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de un mayor numero de zapatos de diversos modelos, para tener un stock disponible para la venta, por lo que espera conseguirlos a menos preciso por su compra en mayor volumen.
texts.en:
Kelita is 54 years old. She is a hardworking working and determined woman as well as being cheerful and friendly. She lives with Angel, who is a mason and father of her children that are already of age and independent. They live comfortably together in their own home.

Kelita sells different styles of shoes for women, men, and children. They are purchased in the city of Lima, thanks to the support of her friend that lives there that buys and sends them to her. Kelita then sells them to her family, friends, and neighbors. She attends to her customers in a kind way, managing to earn their business. She has more than 10 years dedicated to this business, and so far, she has done this alone.

She enjoys her business since it generates an income and gives her an occupation. It also gives her time to be home to take care of their animals (chickens and ducks). She considers her business to be quite profitable, and therefore wants to increase her stock of goods and to make her business grow. On the other hand, she says that she know how to sew, and plans to buy a sewing machine and venture into that business to generate more income.

This will be her 12th loan with the institution MFP. She is very glad to know that she will have financial support, because she will feel safe in growing her business. On the other hand, she feels comfortable with her community bank, because she considers it a united group with solidarity.

With the requested amount of 1200 nuevos soles ($475), she will invest it into buying a greater number of different styles of shoes in order to have a stock available for sale. She hopes to get them for less for purchasing in bulk.

loans.use: to buy wholesale shoes.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol, de 39 años, es una mujer muy buena, amable y trabajadora, está separada hace 05 años del padre de su única hija llamada Jody quien tiene actualmente 12 años y está en etapa escolar, es por ella por quien Marisol trabaja arduamente porque desea brindarle una buena educación y ofrecerle un futuro mejor, vive junto a ella en la casa de sus padres.
El trabajo de Marisol consiste en la venta de productos de belleza, entre los productos que vende destacan los que son usados en aseo y cuidado personal, tratamiento facial, colonias, perfumes, ropa y otros. Todo su trabajo lo realiza en su casa o por las calles de la ciudad entre sus amigos y personas que conoce, cuando se inició en este trabajo hace 06 años le era complicado poder realizarlo con éxito ya que no sabía muy bien como lograr obtener a sus clientes, pero con el tiempo fue aprendiendo y capacitándose en técnicas de ventas, así pudo salir adelante y logró consolidarse como una vendedora exitosa. Complementa su trabajo con otro negocio que también tiene instalado en su casa desde hace 05 años y en él brinda servicio de radiofonía a todas las personas que desean comunicarse con sus familiares o amigos en zonas alejadas de la ciudad.
Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede tener tiempo para poder hacer todas las actividades que desee, además de brindarle también atención a su hija, le está yendo muy bien ya que tiene dos ingresos que le permiten proyectarse algunos planes a futuro, pero lo que desea por ahora es seguir creciendo y aumentar la variedad de productos a ofrecer para que sus ganancias se multipliquen. Por tanto éste será su préstamo número 01 con la institución MFP, está muy contenta de saber que le brindan un apoyo financiero ya que eso le genera seguridad para avanzar con su trabajo, además se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas, está muy tranquila con el grupo de trabajo al que pertenece ya que todos son muy responsables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado 800 soles, comprará productos de belleza en cantidades variables cuyos precios varían según la marca y el tamaño como perfumes, cremas corporales, cremas de manos, talcos, cosméticos y otros accesorios para tener en stock e incrementar la variedad de productos que ofrece a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Marisol is thirty-nine years old and is a very good, kind, and hard-working woman.  She has been separated for five years from the father of her only daughter.  Her daughter is Jody and she is currently twelve years old and in school.  It is for her that Marisol works hard; she wishes to offer her a good education and a better future.  Marisol lives with her daughter in her parent's house.  

Marisol's work is in the sale of beauty products.  Among the products she sells, she specializes in those that are used in personal care and hygiene, like  facial treatments, colognes, perfumes, clothing, and others.  She does all of her work in her house or in the streets of the city among her friends and acquaintances.  

When she began this business six years ago, it was complicated to successfully sell because she didn't know how to gain a customer base.  However with time, she has been learning and training in sales techniques, and has moved forward and become a successful saleswoman.

She complements this work with another business that she also has carried out from her home for five years.  She offers radiotelephony service to all those individuals that wish to communicate with family or friends that live in areas that are very far from the city.  

What she likes about her job is that she has time to be able to do all of the things she wants.  In addition, she can give more attention to her daughter.  It is going well, since she has two incomes that allow her to plan some future projects.  She now wishes to continue growing and increasing the variety of products that she offers so that her profits will multiply.  

This will be her first loan with the institution.  She is very happy to know that they offered her financial support, which gives her security to move forward with her work.  In addition. she promises to pay her installments on time.  She is very calm with the work group that she belongs to; everyone is very responsible and caring.  

With the amount she is requesting (800 soles), she will buy beauty products in varying quantities, whose prices vary according to the brand and size.  She will buy perfumes, body creams, hand creams, talcum powder, cosmetics, and other accessories to have in stock and to increase the variety of products that she offers to her customers.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, body creams, hand creams, talcum powder, cosmetics, and other items.

loans.name: Mehboob

texts.en:
Mehboob is a very hardworking and active borrower of Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. He is 53 years old and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with his family. His family includes his wife, who is a decent and responsible house wife, two sons and a daughter. The elder son, who is 26 years old is doing the same business with his father, while the younger two children are students.

Since 2007 Mehboob has been running his own pharmacy, which is the only source of income for the family. Currently, he is interested in purchasing more medicines for the shop. For that purpose, he has requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 PKR. 

The loan will help Mehboob to increase his net income and savings. He wants to use some of the profit amount to open a new shop for his brother, in the future. Many thanks to all staff of Kiva and BRAC Pakistan from Mehboob's family.

loans.use: To purchase some medicines for his pharmacy.

loans.name: Manoj Kumar

texts.en:
Manoj Kumar is a 30 years old differently-abled person living in a small village of Odisha, India. He is engaged in the activity of decorating and making tent houses for events like marriages and during other Hindu rituals. He has tents, a few musical instruments and speakers with him which he installs wherever the events are performed. He has 8 years of experience in this activity.

Manoj Kumar lives with his mother, wife, elder brother and his two son aged 6 and 5 years. He is only the earning person in his family.

He has requested a loan amount 50,000 Indian Rupees (INR) for purchasing new upgraded music instruments and bamboo for installing his tent house.

He wants to see his sons in a good school and save some money to grow his business.

loans.use: to purchase new upgraded music instruments, lights and bamboo for installing his tent house.

loans.name: Harutyun

texts.en:
Harutyun is still engaged in his mixed products business. He added more products to his inventory and, step by step, his business is going up. Thanks to his profits, Harutyun can provide for his family and help his jobless brother. He now has a lot of regular customers who prefer to buy pipes, wire rope, water valves, pitchforks and many other house repair products from him. This has led Harutyun to enlarge his rental stall and to increase his products. 
Harutyun needs a loan of $2,500 US to buy lots of goods such as pipes, wire rope, water valves, pitchforks, etc. for his shop.

loans.use: to buy lot of goods such as pipes, wire rope, water valves, pitchforks, etc. for his shop

loans.name: Raeesa's Group

texts.en:
Raeesa is a very hardworking housewife. She lives with her husband, daughter, and son in Punjab, Pakistan. 

Since 2007, her husband has had been running his own general store, and he works very hard to meet his family needs. He needs additional capital for the growth of his business. His wife Raeesa is a member of seven-person lending group, and she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. 

With the loan money, her husband can purchase a variety of goods for his general store like sugar, flour, rice, biscuits, etc., to satisfy his clients more professionally, as well as to increase his savings for the better future of his children.

Raeesa and her husband are very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for their family.

Note: In the picture, Raeesa carrying a passbook in her hand.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of goods for a general store

loans.name: Iza

texts.en:
Iza is 20 years-old, divorced and lives with her parents, brother and two-year-old son in the suburb of the capital city. Several times, she has requested loans from local financial institutions for her hair care business start-up but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected each time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. The only source of income for the family is the small monthly salaries earned by Iza’s brother working as a tin man and her father who is a furniture restorer. Total average monthly income is 500 GEL, which is enough only for food for a five member family.

Iza has recently finished styling courses and found a job in a beauty salon but she needs special equipment to start her hair care business.  Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisions the provision of a business start-up and re-start-up credits with reasonable conditions for the country's rural poor who do not have access to credit products since they are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of low income.

Iza will purchase equipment such as a hair dryer, combs, brushes, hair clippers and a curling iron. She will work as a stylist, and according to her estimates, the business will be profitable and will increase the income of the family. The increased profit will be reinvested in the same business. Her family will be able to increase their spending to satisfy their daily needs and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase hair care accessories and equipment.

loans.name: Marium's Group

texts.en:
Marium is an active and hard working woman. She is 50 years-old and has three children, two sons and a daughter. Her elder son is a shopkeeper while the rest are taxi drivers. 

Marium has excellent embroidery skills and she sells embroidered products in the market. She is running this business to contribute some amount to the family income and to keep herself busy as she does not like  to waste her skills and precious time by sitting idle at home. Her business is doing well and the demands for her embroidery products are increasing day by day. 

Marium as a member of a six member lending group and has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase fabric and packs of threads of various colors so that she can continue her business in the future as well.

Note: In the picture Marium holds a pass book in her hand.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and packs of threads of various colors for her embroidery business.

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es:
El comité La Amistad es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, son 14 integrantes  muy responsables. Todas son  muy  trabajadoras se reúnen siempre para resolver cualquier problema y también ayudan a su comunidad siempre y entre ellas también.
Liduvina, una de las miembros de este grupo y también es la presidenta, ella comenta que con gran esfuerzo y por medio de su trabajo está creciendo en su negocio, que es una peluquería. Gracias a esta peluquería tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia y cubrir los gastos que día a día surgen.
Liduvina solicita de este crédito para la compra de tintes, gel, peines, shampoo, enjuagues y demás insumos para poder seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes. Agradecen todas las miembros por la ayuda que están recibiendo,  pues les será muy útil.
texts.en:
The communal bank La Amistad (The Friendship) is from the city of San Lorezo and they are 14, very responsible, members. They are all very hardworking women that always meet to resolve any problem, help their community and each other. 
Liduvina is a member of this group and also the president. She shares that through great effort and her work her business is growing, which is a hair salon. Thanks to the hair salon she has the means to help her family and cover the costs that emerge day to day. Liduvina requests this loan to purchase   hair dyes, gel, combs, shampoo, conditioner and other supplies needed to continue providing a good service to her customers. 
All of the members are thankful for the help they are receiving, as it will be very useful to them.

loans.use: to purchase hair dyes, gel, combs, shampoo, conditioner and more.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El Sr. Juan es una persona muy trabajadora, que se esfuerza por salir adelante e ir creciendo. Su negocio de lavadero de automóviles ha ido creciendo y conforme pasa el tiempo le esta yendo mejor.
Este es su segundo crédito con kiva, y gracias al anterior ha podido mejorar mucho su atención, es por eso que solicita nuevamente otro crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de productos de limpieza para poder seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes. Agradece por la nueva oportunidad que recibe, pues nueva,ente le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Juan is a very hardworking person, who exerts himself in order to get ahead and grow his business.  His car wash business has been growing and is improving over time.  

This is Juan's second loan with Kiva. Thanks to his previous loan, he was able to improve his service a lot.  He is requesting a new loan to invest in cleaning products so that he can continue to provide good service to his customers.  

Juan appreciates this new opportunity that he is receiving, because once again, it will be a big help to him.

loans.use: To buy cleaning products.

loans.name: San Isidro Group

texts.es:
15 son las mujeres que se unieron con la esperanza de ayudarse y ayudar a sus familias por medio de sus esfuerzos. Silvia es una de estas mujeres, ella es modista, y comenta que tiene muy buen trabajo y es por eso que está saliendo adelante ya que sus clientes aprecian mucho su trabajo. Silvia ha crecido mucho, ya que empezó con un pequeño tallercito y está creciendo gracias a su esfuerzo.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, gomas, cierres y demás. Todo su grupo agradece por la ayuda que todas reciben pues les ayuda a seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
15 are the women that got together with the hope to help each other and their families through their efforts.  Silvia is one of these women, she is a tailor, and mentions that she has really good work, which is why she is getting ahead, because her customers appreciate her work very much.  Silvia has grown a lot, she started with a small shop and is growing thanks to her efforts.
She requests a loan to be able to invest it in buying fabric, threads, elastics, zippers and more.  Her whole group is thankful for the help that they all receive, because it helps them grow.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, threads, elastics, zippers and other items.

loans.name: Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El comité “Katupyry” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, pero también trabajan juntas para poder ayudarse.
 La señora Carolina, está casada y tiene hijos, se dedica a la lavandería. Lava todo tipo de prendas, de sus vecinos y personas de zonas aledañas que siempre se acercan a ella para poder traerles trabajo.
Carolina solicita de este crédito para poder comprar jabones, suavizantes para ropas y demás.
texts.en: The committee “Katupyry” was formed with the union of several neighbors of the city of Santani.  All the members in the committee perform independent activities, but they also work together to help each other.  Carolina is married and has children, she works in laundry services.  She washes all types of clothing, neighbors' and people's that live in nearby zones that come to her and bring her work.   Carolina requests the loan to buy soaps, fabric softener and other items.

loans.use: to buy soaps, fabric softener and others.

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.es:
16 mujeres se han unido con el propósito de ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo en equipo de todas ellas. Gracias a ese sacrificio todas ya están en su ciclo numero 19, y comentan que con la ayuda de la fundación sus vidas han mejorado.
La Sra. Félida tiene 2 hijos  está acompañada  con el Sr. Víctor, ella se dedica hace varios años a la venta de bebidas y comidas. Y se ha hecho de muy buena fama en su barrio ya que atiende muy bien a sus clientes y les da un buen servicio.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de bebidas. Agradece por la ayuda que ellas y sus amigas han recibido, ya que han mejorado mucho sus vidas y siguen creciendo.
texts.en:
Sixteen women have come together to help their families by working as one all-inclusive team.  Thanks to everyone's sacrifice, they are already on their nineteenth loan cycle, and they say that with the Foundation's help their lives have improved.

Félida has two children, and is accompanied by Victor.  Félida has been selling food and drinks for a number of years, and she has developed quite a good reputation in her neighborhood because she treats her clientele really well and provides good service.  

She is seeking this loan to invest in the purchase of drinks.  She is grateful for the help that she and her friends have received because they continue to grow and their lives have been greatly improved.

loans.use: to buy drinks to sell.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a trisikad (pedicab) transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for her trisikad transportation vehicle.

NWTF is relisting Leonila's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her trisikad (pedicab) business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy goats to fatten and then sell.

loans.name: Augustine M's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is a partner of Kiva based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone.   They are very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from one of the secondary schools in Kenema city, in eastern Sierra Leone. 

Teachers and workers of other institutions normally come to SMT in order to request a loan. These loans help a great deal to supplement their monthly salaries. They use these loans to buy or invest in things that their mere salary alone can’t let them buy or invest in. At the end of each month, these teachers can easily repay the loan using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

Augustine is the featured leader of this group. The 37 year-old is a native of Pendembu, in eastern Sierra Leone. He is married to a housewife and the couple has one child who is in college. Augustine is a teacher who has served six years in the teaching profession. He has requested for this loan in order to buy house building materials such as bags of cement and iron corrugated rods for the construction of a house.

loans.use: to buy house building materials such as bags of cement and iron corrugated rods for the construction of a house.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia works hard to support her family.

She has a trisikad (pedicab) transport business in the Philippines. Emilia is borrowing PHP 24000 through NWTF to buy an additional trisikad.

Emilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional trisikad (pedicab).

loans.name: Crescencia

texts.en:
Crescencia is 62 years old and married with 13 children.

Crescencia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Crescencia has been in this business for 20 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Crescencia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en: Esterlita is 55 years old and married with 7 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell. Esterlita has been in this business for 11 years and has previously received funds through Kiva. Esterlita aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Juan Neptali

texts.es:
Juan tiene 20 años de edad es  soltero no tiene hijos vive con la madre en el Recinto SAN FRANCISCO perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla CEVALLOS se encuentra ubicada el  recinto SAN FRANCISCO, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Juan se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de  arroz y la crianza de animales de corral como pollos y cerdos. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades, ademas alieto para los animales balanceado. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

El crédito le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos y los cultivos. El sueño es comprar una casa para vivir con la madre, en los tiempos libres le gusta hacer porte con los amigos.
texts.en:
Juan is 20 years old and single. He has no children and lives with his mother in the SAN FRANCISCO area, belonging to the canton of Ventanas, in the province of Los Ríos. 

He works for the CEVALLOS office located in the SAN FRANCISCO area, it belongs to the canton of Ventanas, which is dedicated to agricultural and livestock work.

Juan is dedicated to agriculture through the planting of rice and the raising of animals, like chickens and pigs. With the loan, he will buy items like fertilizers and insecticides to avoid pests and diseases, plus supplements for the animals. He shops in the city of Ventanas.

The loan will help to increase his revenue and crops. His dream is to buy a house to live in with his mother. In his free time he likes to play spots with his friends.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides to avoid pests and diseases.

loans.name: Monica Isabel

texts.es:
Mónica Isabel tiene 32 años vive en unión libre tiene un hijo, vive con el esposo y con el hijo de ocho años de edad en el Cantón ventanas provincia de los ríos.

VRC CEVALLOS, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN EL RECINTO SAN FRANCISCO, PERTENECE A LA PARROQUIA SAN JUAN DE PUEBLO VIEJO SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRICOLAS. 

Mónica Isabel  se dedica a la crianza de animales como gallinas y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para compra de animales cómo pollos, cerdos, patos.
Con el apoyo del crédito podrá comprar mas animales para críarlos y poder venderlos a un buen precio.


El sueño de la señora es comprar más animales y que el negocio cresca. El desafío al que se enfrenta es la dcompetencia.En su tiempo libre se dedica a sus animales.
texts.en:
Mónica Isabel is 32 years old. She is in a common-law relationship, and she has a son. She lives with her husband and her eight year old son in the Ventanas canton in the Los Ríos province. The Cevallos community bank is located in the recinto San Francisco in the San Juan de Pueblo Viejo parish. They work in agriculture.

Mónica Isabel rears animals such as chickens and pigs. She is requesting the loan to purchase chickens, pigs, and ducks. With the loan, she will be able to buy more animals to rear and sell at good prices.

Her dream is to buy more animals and for her business to grow. Her main challenge is the competition. In her free time she takes care of her animals.

loans.use: to purchase animals like chickens, pigs, and ducks to rear.

loans.name: Abdulai Y's Group

texts.en:
In the picture above are teachers from one of the secondary schools in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers, Abdulai Y's Group, has come to Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva, to apply for a cumulative loan of SLL 14,300,000. With the help of this loan, this group of teachers will be able to meet their immediate financial challenges. And at the end of each month, their school’s bursar will repay the loan on their behalf.

The featured leader of this group is Abdulai. Abdulai is 40 years of age. He is a native of Matrujon, in southern Sierra Leone. He is married to a housewife and the two have three children. Two of the children are in school, one in primary school and one in secondary school. Abdulai has served in the teaching profession for 21 years. He has requested this loan in order to buy house-building materials like sand, cement, rods, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials like sand, cement, rods, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay college fees for her children.

loans.name: Jemi

texts.es:
Jemi, de 37 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de servicial y amable. Es conviviente con Jesús quien es empleado y padre de sus 02 hijos de 15 y 20 años. Vive en compañía de su pareja y sus hijos, instalados cómodamente en su propia casa. El negocio que tiene Jemi es la venta de bebidas gasificadas, para eso cuenta con una refrigeradora la cual compró  con ayuda de su pareja y la instalaron en su casa, donde atienden a sus clientes amable y cordialmente. 
Más de 05 años que viene funcionando su negocio donde ella sola atiende a  sus clientes. 
Viendo que faltaba dinero para los gastos del hogar se inició por la idea de su pareja quien le aconsejo que pusiera éste negocio, y observando que las bebidas tienen demanda por el clima caluroso de la zona. Como tenia unos ahorros decidió emprender en este nuevo negocio.
 Le gusta su negocio pues le permite tener un ingreso económico para apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar, así como también le permite estar en casa para cuidar y atender a sus hijos a los quiere mucho y desea sacar adelante, siendo su motivación para seguir esforzándose, por eso tiene planes de ampliar su negocio y abrir un restaurante en su casa ya que su pareja sabe de cocina y ha visto que es una buena zona para esta venta. Por tanto éste será el préstamo número 08 con la institución MFP, por eso espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Se compromete a ser responsable con el pago de sus cuotas como en los créditos anteriores, de esa manera tener acceso a otros créditos en el futuro.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en su negocio en ampliar comprando más bebidas gasificadas al por mayor  a menos precios para así tener mayor margen de ganancias.
texts.en:
Jemi is 37 years old and is a hardworking, dedicated women.  She is also friendly and helpful.  She lives with Juan, who works, and they have two children, ages 15 and 20.  They all live comfortably in their home.  Jemi sells soft drinks and has a refrigerator that she bought with her husband’s help.  They set it up in her home, where they serve customers happily and politely.  She has had this business for more than five years.

Seeing that she needed money for the household expenses, she got an idea and her husband suggested that she set up this business, seeing that the drinks they had were in demand because of the hot weather in the zone.  Since she had some savings, she decided to start this new business.

She likes her business because it allows her to have an income to help her husband with the household expenses.  It also allows her to be at home to care for her children; she loves them very much and wants to see them get ahead.  They are her motivation for working hard and she plans to expand her business and open a restaurant in her home, because her husband knows about cooking and has seen that this is a good area for this type of sale.  This will be her 8th loan through MFP and she is hoping for your cooperation so she can continue with her goals.  She promises to be responsible with her payments as with previous loans.  In this way she can have access to other loans in the future.

She will use the 1,000 PEN to buy soft drinks in quantity and at better prices so she can increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks.

loans.name: Zorigoo

texts.en:
Zorigoo, 46 years old, lives with his wife and son in a ger (traditional Mongolian yurt) in Darhan province, Mongolia. His wife Altantuya is an assistant at a local private company. Her son Zorigoo, age 24, works at a private IT company.

Zorigoo has been working at auto repair service companies since 1988. He is now planning to open his own auto repair service on his spare land. He is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to purchase necessary equipment, tools and other items to start his own business. Zorigoo is a hardworking, active and well-experienced man.

loans.use: to purchase necessary equipment, tools and other items to start his own business

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 35 años que vive en la ciudad de Atuntaqui, ella tiene 2 hijos vive junto a su esposo y sus hijos, María se define como una persona  alegre, honrada, respetuosa muy trabajadora, María desde mucho tiempo atrás decidió emprender un negocio con el que pueda ayudar económicamente a su esposo, es por ello que se dedicó a la crianza y venta de animales, dándole buenos resultados y mejorando la calidad de vida de toda su familia.
El crédito solicitado a FODEMI será invertido en la compra de cuyes pequeños para la crianza y la posterior venta, además se invertirá en la adecuación de las jaulas donde se criaran los cuyes. María está convencida de invertir en su negocio ya que le está yendo cada vez mejor y está teniendo mayores ingresos económicos. 
María quiere cumplir su sueño de tener un criadero grande de pollos y cuyes para ser una microempresaria distribuidora para los mercados de su ciudad, y con esto ayudar en la educación de sus hijos
texts.en:
María is a 35 year old woman that lives in the city of Atuntaqui. She has two children that live with her, her husband, and his children. María is defined as a  cheerful, honest, respectful, hardworking woman. María decided long ago to start a business that could help her husband financially. For this reason, she devoted herself to the raising and selling of animals, with good results, improving the quality of life for her family.

The loan requested from FODEMI will be invested in buying Guinea pigs to raise and then sell. In addition, she will invest in the adequacy of the cages where the Guinea pigs will live. María is convinced that investing in her business will bring her more income since it is doing better every day.

María wants to fulfill her dream to have a large hatchery of chickens and Guinea pigs, and to be a small business distributor for the markets it her city. This will help the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy Guinea pigs and cages in which to raise them, for subsequent sale in the city market.

loans.name: Tazakhan

texts.en:
Tazakhan is from the village Kesalo, Gardabani district. He is 42 years old and lives with his family, wife and 20-year-old son. Tazakhan and his son are builders and get monthly income. Besides, they are involved in agricultural business and grow greens on the family-owned land. The harvested products are sold at the local open market.  

Tazakhan received the loan in the framework of a start-up program. He will start a new family business with the loan. He plans to purchase calves. After several months the calves will turn into milk cows. Tazakhan will start cheese production. He will sell the cheese on the local market. It will significantly increase the income of the family. Tazakhan will be able to purchase additional household goods to improve the family living conditions. Also part of the additional profit will be reinvested in dairy farming, in order to improve it and increase its profitability.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Justine is a widow who has two children. She wants money to buy some materials that she will use to sew and sell as dresses. She buys materials that are locally referred to as "bitenge"; this is a traditional attire that cuts across most African countries. Being a festive season, she hopes to make good sales out of the dresses. She still has challenges of limited capital, so Justine cannot satisfy the demands of her customers as well as hire some other person to help her with the sewing which makes her deliveries slow. She is sure this will soon change with the helping hand from Ugafode.

loans.use: To buy materials for dressmaking

loans.name: Saiideh

texts.en:
Saiideh is a 42-year-old single woman who has been working in sewing, bead work and embroidery for eight years. She used to work as a nurse, but she felt that it is better to start her own business to improve her living.

Saiideh is working from home. She is applying for her fifth cycle loan in order to buy and register a new car that will help her a lot in going to the market and buying the necessary threads, beads, needles and many other fabrics to expand her business. With half of the loan, Saiideh is going to buy necessary beads, threads, needles and fabrics to improve her business too. She hopes to complete improving her business as much as she can to improve her living. Her previous loans helped her a lot in expanding her working domain which reflected positively on her living.

loans.use: to buy a new car along with needed supplies that will help her in improving her business

loans.name: Mame D B

texts.fr: Mame D B est une femme mariée qui exerce le commerce de chaussures depuis plus de cinq ans maintenant.Elle est mère de trois enfants dont deux filles qui fréquentent l'école primaire.Les revenus tirés de son activité lui permettent de subvenir à ses besoins et de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge des dépenses d'entretien de la famille.Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite un pret de 200000f pour acheter 50 paires de chaussures en cuir. Son ambition est d'implanter une cantine de vente d'articles vestimentaires devant son domicile.
texts.en:
Mame D B is a married woman who has been selling shoes for over five years. She is the mother of three children, two of them girls who attend primary school. The income earned through her activity allow her to support herself and to help her husband to provide for their family’s needs. 

She is seeking a loan of 200,000f to strengthen her business by purchasing 50 pairs of leather shoes. 

Her goal is to open a kiosk in front of her home to sell apparel.

loans.use: to buy 50 pairs of shoes for resale.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Adama is 28 years old and married with 1 child who is eight years old. She sells Chinese lights in Kulanda town, Southern area, in Sierra Leone.

She's been in this business for five years and sells Chinese lights within a busy market area. Her husband is a business man; she also receives income from her husband. She says that the main challenge to her business is during the rainy season, she finds it difficult to have normal sales.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more electrified products (Chinese lights). She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to improve her life and her family's well-being. In the future, she would like expand her business to an international level. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more electrified products (Chinese lights).

loans.name: Jesus Deliva

texts.es:
Deliva tiene 58 años de edad es  soltera no tiene hijos vive solo en el Recinto SAN FRANCISCO perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla CEVALLOS se encuentra ubicada el  recinto SAN FRANCISCO, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Deliva se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de  arroz y la crianza de animales de corral como pollos y cerdos. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades, ademas alieto para los animales balanceado. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

El crédito le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos y los cultivos. El sueño es tener buena salud para seguir trabajando, en los tiempos libres le gusta caminar por el campo.
texts.en:
Deliva is 58 years old. She is single and has no children. She lives in the SAN FRANCISCO area, belonging to the canton of Ventanas, in the province of Los Ríos. 

She belongs to the office of CEVALLOS, which is located in the SAN FRANCISCO area, belonging to the canton of Ventanas, which is dedicated to agricultural and livestock work.

Deliva is dedicated to agriculture through the planting of rice and the raising of animals, like chickens and pigs. With the loan, she will buy items like fertilizers and insecticides to avoid pests and diseases, in addition to supplements for the animals. She does her shopping in the city of Ventanas. 

The loan will help to increase revenue and crops. Her dream is to have good health to be able to continue working. In her free time she likes to walk in the countryside.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides to avoid pests and diseases.

loans.name: Charity Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of two partners, Charity and Rebecca. They sell sponges, underwear, bags and cooked rice (Jollof) respectively. They have been together from 2010 to date.

Charity is a 42 year-old trader who is married to Emmanuel, 44 years-old and who works as security personnel. They have a child. She has been with ID Ghana for the past one year.

She has been selling for nine years now. She hawks from Mondays to Saturdays. 

This is her fifth loan and she needs GHS 400 in order to buy more sponges, bags and underwear to sell to her customers.  

Together they need a total amount of GHS 800 to buy more goods to sell to their customers in the community.

loans.use: to buy bags, sponges and underwear to sell to customers.

loans.name: Kacheera Devt Co-Save Group

texts.en:
Jackline, a member of the group above, lives in Kacheera, a local suburb in rural Lyantonde. The area is affected by a poor road network that is impassable and inaccessible, especially during the rainy season when it floods. Nevertheless, Jackline is determined to increase her agricultural production and provide tuition for her children. She will use the loan to buy Irish potato seeds for planting. It's the rainy season now and planting season as well so she hopes the yields will come out perfectly. The proceeds from the sales will be used to pay tuition for her children during the next academic year. 

Jackline is hardworking and social and thanks group members for introducing her to the group from which she has learned to be responsible and have better upbringing for her children.The eighth person on the right is the Ugafode staff, while the one seated is the group chairperson who is resting this cycle. The rest are the group members and on the extreme right, standing, is Jackline.

loans.use: To buy Irish potato seeds for planting

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 37 years old. She is married and has one child, aged 8.  In 2000, she established her brass religious-making business. Working six days per week and eight hours per day, she supports her family. 

Mila has already received and successfully repaid four loans from Patan Business and Professional Women (Patan BPW) and will use her most recent one to buy raw materials for her business. In the future, Mila plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Nepal has a long and rich history of traditional handicrafts. Throughout the Kathmandu Valley, skilled artisans produce unique pieces of art that reflect Nepal's cultural diversity. Terra cotta pottery comes from the red clay of the surrounding Himalayan foothills. Bronze and silver statuettes are formed using wax molds and intricate hand-tool finishing. In Patan, Newari culture and traditions are reflected in the images and symbols etched into metal or formed in stone.  

With the help of a Kiva loan, Nepal's artisans are able to purchase raw materials in greater volume. This increase in volume allows a single artisan to work on several pieces at the same time, while increasing his or her profit margin.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her brass artisan business.

loans.name: Annemarie

texts.en:
Meet 38-year-old Annemarie from Kandeh town Bo. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 8 and 20 years old. One of her children is currently attending school. In 2003, Annemarie established her local food business. She began her business because she wants to generate a permanent source of income. She works at the business 6 days per week and 12 hours per day. She says that the main challenge to her business is the poor road network to her operation area.

Annemarie requires a loan in order to buy more local products like native rice and gallon palm oil. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and improve her level of conditions. In the future, Annemarie plans to run an international business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more local products like native rice and gallon palm oil

loans.name: Sonu

texts.en: Sonu is 37 years-old. She is married and has 2 children aged 16 and 13. In 2002, she established her poultry farming business. Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy small chickens for her business. In the future, Sonu plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. In the Kathmandu Valley, raising poultry for eggs and meat is a very profitable business. Kiva loans are used to purchase chicks, food, and necessary medicine to keep the chickens healthy. Once matured, the chickens are sold at small butcher shops or in the many open air markets throughout the valley.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Safiatu

texts.en:
Meet 43-year-old Safiatu from Kulanda town Bo. She is married with 4 children between the ages of 12 years and 18 years. Three of her children are currently attending school. In 1998, Safiatu established her used clothing business. She began her business because she wants to improve the standard of living for her family. She works at the business every day, from morning to evening .She says that the main challenges to her business are insufficient capital and poor road network to her operation area.

Safiatu requires a loan in order to buy more bed cotton, window cotton and different type of clothing material. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve the life of her family and give her children a better education. In the future, Safiatu plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bed cotton, window cotton and different type of clothing material.

loans.name: Redentor

texts.en:
This is Redentor who previously accessed a 14,000 PHP loan to buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in his business. His earnings were a big help in meeting his personal, household and business expenses. He is working hard to provide income for his child. He also has a variety store for additional income.

He would like to apply for another 16,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of his tricycle unit. He looks forward to a financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Redentor dreams to have another tricycle. He also hopes to give a good education to his child. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of his tricycle unit.

loans.name: Alimatu

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Alimatu from Kulanda town, Southern area, in Bo. She is married with 5 children between the ages of 9 years and 24 years. She began this business because her family did not educate her, so the only way for her to earn money is to run a business in order to sustain her family.

Alimatu runs a home products business. She sells food containers, and rubber buckets. She has been running this business for 10 years. She works at the business 6 days per week and 11 hours per day. She says her business is the only income she has. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and during the rainy season sales are slow. 

Alimatu has requested a loan in order to buy variety of home products like food containers, and rubber buckets. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her capital. In the future, she plans to build a house. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy variety of home products like food containers, and rubber buckets.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, de 66 años, es una mujer amable y muy trabajadora, es madre de dos hijos de 46 y 42 años, vive junto a ellos, sus nietos y a su pareja en la casa propia que lograron edificar como resultado de su trabajo y mucho esfuerzo. Comparten sus días trabajando mucho para poder tener una mejor calidad de vida en familia.
El trabajo de Rosa consiste en la venta de refrescantes gaseosas, pero principalmente se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y artículos de perfumería y arreglo personal. Su trabajo comienza en las mañanas e inicia su recorrido por su barrio y las principales calles de la ciudad ofreciendo todos los productos que tiene para vender, esta es una forma de conseguir nuevos clientes y mantener a los que ya tiene, por las tardes regresa a casa y espera la llegada de su público para atenderlos con mucha cordialidad y salgan comprando algún perfume, crema u otro artículo de su preferencia. La venta de gaseosas lo hace con ayuda de sus nietos cuando ella no se encuentra en casa, y el horario de mayor venta es por las noches ya que su nuera se dedica a la venta de comida y esta es una oportunidad perfecta para que los clientes que acuden a saciar su apetito también consuman sus refrescantes bebidas. 
Le gusta mucho lo que hace ya que le permite estar todo el día en constante actividad. Se siente útil y con mucha energía para continuar trabajando por el bien de su familia, ahora tiene muchos planes de mejorar las condiciones de exhibición de los productos que ofrece a la venta en su casa y para eso necesita comprar algunos mostradores y otros accesorios. Por tanto éste será su préstamo número 03 con la institución MFP, espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, le gusta el trabajo que viene realizando en su banco comunal apoyando a las personas en avanzar con sus negocios
Con el monto solicitado 800 nuevos soles, comprará productos de perfumería y cuidado personal como cremas, talcos, colonias y cosméticos variados y de las mejores marcas para continuar con su trabajo, al mismo tiempo comprará 10 cajas de gaseosa semanal para complementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Rosa, 66, is a friendly and hardworking woman. She is the mother of two children, 46 and 42 years old. She lives with them, her grandchildren, and her partner in their own home. They managed to build the home as a result of hard work and a lot of effort. She spends her days working in order to have a better quality of life.

Rosa is mainly engaged in the sale of cosmetics, perfume, and personal grooming items, but also sells soft drinks. Her work begins in the mornings when she starts her journey through her neighborhood and the main streets of the city offering all of the products she has for sale. This is a way to get new customers and to keep the ones she already has. In the evenings, she goes back home and awaits the arrival of her customers and attends to them with cordiality while they buy perfume, cream, or other items. She sells soft drinks with the help of her grandchildren when she is not home. Her biggest selling hours are in the evenings since her daughter-in-law sells food and this is the perfect opportunity for those customers to consume refreshing beverages.

She enjoys what she does and being busy all day. She feels useful and has lots of energy to continue working for the good of her family. Now, she has many plans to improve the display of her products she sells from home, and for that she needs to buy some counters and other accessories. This will be her 3rd loan with the institution MFP. She hopes with their collaboration she can continue with her goals. On the other hand, she likes the work being done by the community bank, supporting people moving forward with their businesses.

With the requested amount, 800 nuevos soles ($325), she will buy perfume and personal care products like creams, talcs, colognes, and various cosmetics to continue her work. At the same time, she will buy 10 cases of soft drinks weekly to supplement their income.

loans.use: to buy cases of soft drinks.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Fatmata from Kandeh town Bo. She is married with 4 children between the ages of 3 years and 17 years. Her children are currently attending school. In 1999, Fatmata established her Cookery business. She began her business because she wants to generate income to support her home as she did not go to school. She works at the business every day, starting food preparations at 5:00 am, she will not rest until the food is finished. She says cookery is the best business for her because the cookery sales help her to feed her children. She describes herself as a hard working woman.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to buy more bags of rice, vegetable oil and cooking seasoning. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and improve the life of herself and children. In the future, Fatmata wants her business to grow to a higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bags of rice, vegetable oil and cooking seasoning.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 50-year-old Fatmata from Kandeh town. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 20 years and 30 years. One of her children attends school. 

To earn a living, she runs a dry fish business within a busy market area. She has been running this business for 25 years. She works at the business from morning to night, 7 days per week, and her younger daughter usually helps her run the business. Her other source of income comes from her elder daughter. At present she describes her major problem as insufficient transportation in her community.

Fatmata has requested a loan in order to buy more fish to resell. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her living. In the future, she plans to have another fish table. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more fish to resell

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is 48-year-old Hawa from Kandeh town Bo. She is married with 2 children between the ages of 12 years and 20 years.

Hawa runs a general retail business. She sells soap, milk, sweets, and biscuits. She has been running this business for 7 years. She works at the business every day from morning to night. Her business is the only income she has. She says that her business is doing well. 

Hawa has requested a loan in order to buy more general stock like soap, milk, sweets, and biscuits.  The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her standard of living. In the future, she plans to buy a plot of land. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more general stock like soap, milk, sweets, and biscuits.

loans.name: Francis M's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers of a primary school in Kenema city, in eastern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, to request a loan of 10,100,000 SLL for the entire group. With the help of this loan, each of these teachers will be able to meet their immediate financial challenges and at the end of each month, each will repay the loan using their monthly salaries.
