It is the school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deducations and making the repayments on their behalf.

Francis is the featured leader of this group of teachers. He is 49 years of age. A native of Koyomaniji, in eastern Sierra Leone. He is married to a trader and the couple has 7 children – 1 in primary school and 6 in college. Francis has been a teacher for 28 years now. In addition to his teaching profession, he also sells products like cola (a chewing nut very popular in West Africa) coffee, cocoa, etc. He has been selling for 3 years now. With the help of this loan, Francis is going to buy the above mentioned items in large quantities to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy cola, coffee, cocoa, etc., in large quantities to add to his business.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice, a married woman, has five children and 3 dependents. She sells charcoal to meet the needs of her family. She works six days a week. At the beginning she and the family were solely depended on her husband, who is a casual labourer, and his income was not enough to feed and educate the children. She therefore started by buying and selling one bag but is now able to sell over 10 bags in two weeks. 

Charcoal is used as fuel by most low income earners because it is affordable compared to gas and electricity. This has improved her standard of living and she hopes to build a modest house out of the profits. She is grateful for the partnership she has with Ugafode because her family can now enjoy a healthy meal and also dress appropriately which was not the case years back. She is determined to keep up the pace which is paying off.

loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Rosa Juana

texts.es:
Rosa tiene cuarenta años de edad vive en unión libre tiene dos hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos  en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

VRC CEVALLOS, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN EL RECINTO SAN FRANCISCO, PERTENECE A LA PARROQUIA SAN JUAN DE PUEBLO VIEJO SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRICOLAS.

Rosa  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao, además se dedica a la críanza de animales como gallinas y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos, líquido mata maleza, urea y comprar un cerdo y alimento para los animales.

Con el apoyo del crédito podrá comprar lo que le hace falta para la siembra de cacao y podrá comprar un animal. El sueño es tener un terreno. 

En su tiempo libre se dedica a sus animales.
texts.en:
Rosa is forty years old. She is in a common law marriage and has two children. She lives with her husband and their two children in Ventanas cantón, in Los Rios province. 

The Cevallos communal bank is located in the small town of San Francisco, which belongs to the parish of San Juan de Pueblo Viejo. The members work in agricultural activities.

Rosa works in agriculture, planting cacao. She also raises animals such as chickens and pigs. She is requesting the loan to buy fertilizers, herbicides, urea, and also to buy a pig and food for the animals. 

With the support of the loan, she will buy what she still needs for planting her cacao and she will also buy an animal. Her dream is to have some land. 

In her free time she takes care of her animals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides, urea, and also to buy a pig and food for her animals.

loans.name: Miatta

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Miatta from Kulanda town Bo; she is married with 3 children between the ages of 2 month and 11 years old. She began her business because her parents stopped paying her school fees when she got pregnant with her first child, so she decided to start a business in order to have a permanent source of income. 

Miatta runs a palm oil business within her neighborhood. She sells palm oil, coconut oil and nut oil. She has been running this business for 12 years. She works at the business 11 hours per day and 6 days per week. Her husband is a business man; she also receives income from him. She says that the main challenge to her business is the slow purchasing power of customers.

Miatta has requested a loan in order to buy more palm oil as well as other goods to resell. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children school fees and increase her business. In the future, she plans to see her business grow bigger. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil as well as other goods to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Gladys Erlinda

texts.es:
Gladys  es una mujer de 30 años, terminó la secundaria gracias a la ayuda de sus padres que a pesar de los escasos recursos pudieron proveerle a su hija la educación. Luego ella hizo un esfuerzo para prepararse en algo adicional y estudió en una academia de belleza. Es soltera y tiene un hijo, para ella ha sido muy difícil educar sola a su hijo, pero él se ha convertido en la inspiración de cada día para salir adelante en su trabajo. Viven en Pastaza, un cantón ubicado en la Provincia con el mismo nombre, perteneciente a la Región Amazónica de la República del Ecuador. La cabecera cantonal es la ciudad del Puyo una ciudad ubicada en medio de la selva amazónica al occidente de la provincia de Pastaza y a 924 m. sobre el nivel del mar. Es demográficamente pequeña pero tiene una gran variedad de sitios que son los preferidos para turistas nacionales e internacionales sobre todo los de actividades ecológicas y de deportes extremos. Una ciudad que crece económicamente cada día por las actividades de comercio, ganadería, agricultura y turismo, por lo que en ella se han establecido sucursales de empresas financieras y comerciales que pretenden aprovechar la actividad económica que mantiene esta ciudad. En cada negocio se encuentra personas que no se han dado por vencidas frente a la falta de empleo sino que han emprendido con sus ideas de negocio para llevar una vida digna y hacer realidad sus sueños.
Gladys aprendió rápido en la Academia de Belleza a la que asistió y también adquirió experiencia en esta actividad desde muy joven. Ahora tiene su propio Salón de Belleza que se ha convertido en el sustento para su hogar, negocio al cual le dedica 12 horas diarias con entusiasmo y esfuerzo, pues cree que el trabajo se lo realiza mejor cuando se lo disfruta. Paralelamente, Gladys atiende a su hijo y le ayuda con sus tareas. Ahora ella desea invertir en un producto natural que es el café orgánico y saludable que tiene propiedades curativas y adelgazantes, entre otras. Todo esto porque la misión de la microempresa que ha establecido Gladys no es solo brindar servicios de peluquería sino también de asesoría en estética y salud para sus clientes. Para esta inversión, Gladys requiere un crédito que le ayudará a ofertar y vender este producto y comprar algunas herramientas para su negocio y de esta forma, incrementar sus ingresos y poder brindar a su hijo la educación hasta verlo convertirse en un profesional. Además con la asesoría que su ejecutivo y Fundación Alternativa le han brindado, aprendió a administrar sus bienes de tal forma que también pueda destinar parte de sus utilidades a un fondo de ahorro que le permita con el tiempo adquirir su casa propia para el bienestar de ella y su hijo.
texts.en:
Gladys, 30, finished secondary school thanks to the help of her parents. Despite their scarce resources, they were able to give their daughter an education. Then she made an effort to do something else and studied in a beauty school. She is single and has one son. It has been very difficult for her to raise her son on her own, but now he has become her inspiration to advance in her work every day. They live in Pastaza, a canton in the province of the same name. It belongs to the Amazon region in the Republic of Ecuador. The main city in the canton is the city of Puyo, which is city located in the middle of the amazon jungle in the western part of Pastaza province, 924 meters above sea level. It's small, but it has several sites which are the favorites of domestic and international tourists, above all the sites for ecological activities and extreme sports. It's a city that grows every day because of its trade, ranching, agriculture, and tourism. Several branches of finance and trade companies have been established there to take advantage of the economic activity in the city. In every business, there are people who have not given up in the face of lack of employment, but rather have used their business ideas to live a dignified life and make their dreams a reality.

Gladys learned quickly at the beauty school she attended and she had experience in this field from the time she was young. Now she has her own beauty salon, which has provided for her home. She works 12 hours a day with enthusiasm and effort. She believes work is done better when it is enjoyed. At the same time, Gladys cares for her son and helps him with his homework. Now she wants to invest in a natural product - healthy and organic coffee that has curative and slimming properties, among others. This is because the mission of her small business is not only to provide hairdressing services, but to also give beauty and health advice to her customers. For this investment, she wants a loan that will help her to offer and sell this product and buy some tools for her business. This way, she can increase her income and give her son an education and see him become a professional. In addition to the council that her manager and Fundación Alternativa have given her, she learned to manage her goods in such a way that she can put part of her profits into a savings account. Over time, this will allow her to get her own house for the wellbeing of herself and her son.

loans.use: to invest in the sale of healthy and organic coffee and to buy tools for her business.

loans.name: Timotea

texts.es:
Timotea, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo, porque necesita invertir en su negocio, adquiriendo un lote de medicinas y tambien prendas de vestir, como linazas, suplementos alimenticios, entre otros productos naturales, así como ropa para niños, blusas y ropa interior.
Ella comenta que el préstamo anterior le permitió mejorar el negocio, fortaleciendo el inventario hoy en día se ha trasladado a otra vivienda que es más amplia.
texts.en: Timotea opted to take out a new loan because she needs to invest in her business, buying a batch of medicines and clothing. She will buy linseed and dietary supplements, among other natural products, as well as children's clothing, blouses, and underwear. She says that the previous loan allowed her to improve her business and strengthen her inventory. Today she has moved to another house that is bigger.

loans.use: to buy linseed, dietary supplements, children's clothing, blouses, and underwear.

loans.name: Maria De La Cruz

texts.es:
María tiene cuarenta y dos años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en el Cantón ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

VRC CEVALLOS, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN EL RECINTO SAN FRANCISCO, PERTENECE A LA PARROQUIA SAN JUAN DE PUEBLO VIEJO SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRICOLAS.

María se dedica a la agricultura  a la siembra de arroz, maíz, además se dedica a la cría de gallinas, patos y cerdos. Solicita el crédito comprar semillas, urea, fertilizantes, insecticidas y alimento para los animales.

Con el apoyo del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes que tanta falta le hace para la siembra. Realiza sus compras en Guayaquil.

El sueño de la señora es tener un negocio de ropa grande. El desafío al que se enfrenta la señora es la competencia y las plagas.
texts.en:
Maria, 42, is single and has no children. She lives with her parents in Ventanas Canton, Los Rios Province. Cevallos communal bank is located in the San Francisco neighborhood. It belongs to the San Juan de Pueblo Viejo parish, and the members work in agriculture. 
Maria works in farming, planting rice and corn. She also raises chickens, ducks, and pigs. She is applying for a loan to buy seeds, urea, fertilizer, insecticide, and feed for the animals. With the help of the loan, she will be able to buy the fertilizers that she really needs for the planting. She buys what she needs in Guayaquil. Her dream is to have a large clothing business. She challenges she faces are competition and plagues.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, fertilizers, insecticides, and feed for the animals.

loans.name: Tutu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 39-year-old Tutu from Kandeh town Southern area in Bo. She is divorced with four children between the ages of 7  and 18. Three of her children currently attend school. She started a general store business because she is independent and needs to create income to support her children.

Tutu sells biscuits, drinks, cigarettes and hair relaxer. She has been running this business for five years along with palm oil sales to earn more income. She works at the business every day from morning to night even at odd hours when customer come in to buy. She says her major problem is extending credit to customers who fall to pay back.

Tutu has requested a loan to buy more general commodities like biscuits, drinks, cigarettes and hair relaxer. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children school fees and take proper care of their welfare. In the future, she plans have a permanent structure. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more general commodities like biscuits, drinks, cigarettes and hair relaxer.

loans.name: Massie

texts.en:
Massie is 38 years old and married, with four children between the ages of 8 years and 18 years. She runs a local foodstuff business at her house in Kandeh town. She began this business in order to educate her children and give them proper care. 

Massie has been in this business for ten years. She sells palm oil, gari, and pepper. She also earns income from renting out a house. She says that, at present, her business is doing well.  

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone Microfinance Company Limited, to buy more local foodstuff like palm oil, gari, and pepper. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her family's standard of living. In the future, she would like to open a permanent palm oil store. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil, gari, and pepper for her foodstuff business.

loans.name: Vincent's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from one of the secondary schools in Kenema city, in eastern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers, like their colleague teachers in other SMT operational areas, comes to SMT to request loans. With the help of these loans, they can meet their immediate financial challenges and at the end of each month, they repay the loan using their monthly salaries.
 
Vincent is the featured leader of this group of borrowers. The 42-year-old is a native of Kenema. He is married to a trader and the couple has 4 children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Vincent is a teacher who has served in the teaching profession for 15 years now. Vincent has requested this loan in order to buy house building materials like cement for the construction of a family dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy house building materials like cement for the construction of a family dwelling house.

loans.name: Wilson Agustin

texts.es:
Wilson  tiene 45 años vive en unión libre no tiene hijos, vive con la esposa en el cantón ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

VRC CEVALLOS, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN EL RECINTO SAN FRANCISCO, PERTENECE A LA PARROQUIA SAN JUAN DE PUEBLO VIEJO SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRICOLAS.

Wilson  se dedica a la cría de cerdos, pollos. Solicita el crédito para comprar pollos, cerdos, patos y alimento para los animales.Con el apoyo del crédito va incrementar su negocio. El sueño es comprar ganado.

El desafío al que se enfrenta es la competencia.En su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Wilson, 45, is in a common-law marriage and has no children.  He lives with his wife in Ventanas canton, in the Los Rios province.

He is a member of the communal bank "Cevallos," which is located in Recinto San Francisco, in San Juan De Pueblo Viejo parish.  This bank is made up of people who work in agriculture.

Wilson works raising pigs and chickens.  He is requesting a loan to buy chickens, pigs, ducks, and animal feed.  With this support of this loan, he will be able to grow his business.  His dream is to buy livestock.

The main challenge that Wilson faces is the competition.  

In his free time, Wilson enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to buy chickens, pigs, ducks, and animal feed

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma, de 42 años de edad, es una mujer con muchas ganas de progresar y salir adelante, además de ser amable y cordial con las personas. Es conviviente con Henry quien es obrero y padre de su hijo de 14 años de edad. Juntos están cómodamente instalados en su propia casa que compraron a base mucho esfuerzo.
La actividad que realiza Norma es la venta de comidas por las tardes como juanes y papas rellenas. La  preparación la realiza en su casa y la venta de forma ambulatoria caminando con una bandeja por los aserraderos cercanos a su casa. 
Se inicio vendiendo mazamorras moradas logrando hacer crecer su capital, luego fue aumentado y cambiando al negocio de venta de distintas viandas  logrando bastante acogida y terminando todo lo que preparaba, y hasta el momento lo realiza sola.
Considera su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja y logra terminar todos sus productos.
Decidió a empezar con esta actividad por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso adicional para apoyar a su pareja pues los ingresos de él no les alcanzaban para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
Esta viendo los buenos resultados que tiene en su negocio, desea en un futuro abrir un negocio de un restaurante pues le gusta cocinar. Por tanto éste será el préstamo número 01 con la institución MFP. Está contenta de saber que contará con un apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado, está contenta con su banco comunal pues conoce a sus integrantes y los considera ser personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado de 500 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de los ingredientes necesarios para la preparación de sus alimentos, para así tener un stock disponible y espera encontrar precios bajos por sus compras en volumen.
texts.en:
Norma is 42 years old. She is a woman with a great desire to make progress and get ahead in life. She is also friendly and polite with everyone. She lives with Henry, who is a laborer and the father of her 14 year old son. Together they live comfortably in their own house, which they bought with a lot of hard work.

Norma’s business is selling foods in the afternoons, such as juanes [similar to a tamal] and stuffed potatoes. She prepares them in her house and sells them by walking with a tray of them to the sawmills near her house.

She started out by selling purple corn and fruit pudding and grew her capital. Then she started growing and changing the business to sell different kinds of foods until she had a lot of customers who ate everything she made. 

She considers the business to be successful because of the earnings it makes her and because she always sells all of her products. 

She decided to start this business because of the need for an additional income to help her husband out since his income wasn’t enough to cover the household expenses.

She is seeing good results from her business. In the future she hopes to open a restaurant business because she likes to cook. This will be her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She is happy knowing that she will have financial support to advance her business. She is also happy with her communal bank because she knows the members and considers them to be responsible and supportive people. 

With the requested amount of PEN 500.00 (Peruvian nuevos soles), she will buy ingredients necessary for making her foods so that she will have stock available. She hopes to find low prices and buy in volume.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making her foods

loans.name: Nestor Ivan

texts.es:
Nestor  tiene 21 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC Cevallos, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, Pertenece a la Parroquia San Juan del Pueblo viejo Perteneciente a Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas  a la siembra de cacao.

Nestor  se dedica a la  agricultura a la siembra de cacao , además se dedica a la cría de animales cómo pollos y cerdos.  Solicita el crédito para poder comprar pollos y cerdos y alimento los animales. El crédito le será de mucha ayuda para poder aumentar los animales criarlos y poderlos vender a un buen precio.

El sueño es tener dinero para ponerse otro negocio. en los tiempos libres se dedica a hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Nestor, 21, is single and has no children. He lives with his parents in Ventanas Canton, Los Rios Province. He is a member of the Cevallos communal bank, which is located in the San Francisco neighborhood, San Juan del Pueblo Viejo parish in Ventanas. The members work in agriculture. 
Nestor works in agriculture, planting cacao. He also raises animals like chickens and pigs. He is applying for the loan to buy chicken, pigs, and feed for the animals. The loan will really help him to be able to increase the number of animals he has, raise them, and sell them for a good price. His dream is to have money to be able to start another business. In his free time, he plays sports.

loans.use: to buy chickens, pigs, and feed for the animals.

loans.name: Clara Agripina

texts.es:
Clara tiene 40 años de edad es soltera tiene cinco hijos vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

VRC CEVALLOS, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN EL RECINTO SAN FRANCISCO, PERTENECE A LA PARROQUIA SAN JUAN DE PUEBLO VIEJO SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRICOLAS.

Clara  se dedica a la cría de animales como gallinas y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para compra de pollos, cerdos, patos y para alimento de crianza y engorde.

Con el apoyo del crédito podrá comprar mas animales para la cría. El sueño de la señora es contar con salud. El desafío al que se enfrenta la señora es seguir trabajando para salir adelante.
En su tiempo libre se dedica a sus animales y a limpiar la casa.
texts.en:
Clara is 40 years old. She is single and has five children. She lives in Ventanas cantón, in Los Rios province. 

The Cevallos communal bank is located in the small town of San Francisco, which belongs to the San Juan de Pueblo Viejo parish. The members work in agriculture.

Clara raises animals, such as chickens and pigs. She is requesting the loan to buy chickens, pigs, and ducks, and food to raise and fatten them. 

With the support of the loan, she will be able to buy more animals to raise. Her dream is to be healthy. The challenge she has is to continue working so she can get ahead. 

In her free time, she takes care of her animals and cleans the house.

loans.use: to buy chickens, pigs, and ducks, and food to raise and fatten them.

loans.name: Asheley's Group

texts.en:
Teley, Millicent and Nuel made up the Jon D group. They have been together from 2010 to date and have been very loyal to ID Ghana. Teley and Nuel both sell fish whiles Millicent sells toothpaste and brushes.

Teley is a 41-years-old fish seller, married to Adjetey a 43-years-driver. They are blessed with 3 children. She has been with ID Ghana for the past two years and is doing very well with both her business and family.

She has been a fish seller for 8 years now. She hawks from Mondays to Saturdays. She opted for this business because she dropped out of school due to lack of funds. But with the introduction of ID Ghana to her, she is now doing very well in life. This is her 3rd loan and she needs GHS 800 to buy more fish to sell to her customers. 

The entire group needs a total amount of GHS 1,950 to buy more goods to sell to their customers in the community.

loans.use: to buy fish to supply to customers.

loans.name: Dios Primero Group

texts.es: Emérita de 47 años de edad casada con seis hijos de 11,21,25,28,30 y 34 años los cuales solo uno estudia por que los otros trabajan, inicia su negocio de pulpería donde vende todo tipo de producto de consumo como granos básicos, aceite, golosinas etc., porque a su esposo se le estaba haciendo difícil cuando sus hijos comenzaron a estudiar y ella se vio en la obligación de apoyar en los gastos y así inicia su negocio con muchos sacrificios pero con esfuerzos propios,  ella pertenece al Grupo Solidario Dios Primero el cual consiste en tres miembros Glendys de 37 años de edad casada con un hijo de 10 años que estudia en primaria, ella inicia su negocio con el apoyo de su esposo quien emigro a Estados Unidos para mejorar la vida económica de su familia y la ayudo a poner el negocio el cual ya tiene cuatro años de dedicarse a la compra venta de ropa nueva , y Claudia María de 33 años de edad casada con un hijo de 8 años que estudia en primaria, su negocio consiste en la compra venta de ropa nueva y usada, ella inicia su negocio con esfuerzos propios cuando estudiaba quiso ayudar a su mama con los estudios ya que todos sus hermanos estudiaban inicio con productos al crédito y actualmente tiene once años de tener este negocio, ella son del domicilio de las pilas comarca de Villanueva Municipio de Chinandega, en estas comarcas existe una gran demanda de venta de ropa, y de productos comestibles es una localidad donde predomina la ganadería y agricultura ella están necesitan financiamiento para surtir más sus negocios y están agradecidas por el apoyo que se les está brindando para continuar con sus negocios.
texts.en:
Emérita, 47, is married and has six children, ages 11, 21, 25, 28, 30 and 34, one of whom studies and the rest of whom are working. She started a grocery store business where she sells all types of consumer products such as basic grains, oil, candies, etc. Because it was getting difficult for her husband when their children began to study, she felt an obligation to help with expenses and that is how her business got started, making many sacrifices but using her own efforts.

She belongs to the Group "Solidario Dios Primero", which has three members, one of whom is Glendys, 37, who is married with one 10-year-old son who is in primary school. She began her business with the support of her husband who emigrated to the U.S. to improve the financial conditions of their family and helped her to start up the business, which they have used to buy and sell new clothing for four years. 

Another group member is Claudia María, 33, who is married and has one 8-year-old son who is in primary school. She has a business buying and selling new and used clothing. She began her business with her own efforts. When she was a student, she wanted to help her mother to pay for her studies, since all of her siblings were studying as well. She began by buying products on credit and now she has had this business for 11 years. 

These women's home county, in the region of Pilas, is Villanueva Municipality in Chinandega. In these regions there is a great demand for clothing sales, and in terms of edible products it is a location where cattle and agriculture predominate. 

They need financing to help stock up their businesses, and they are thankful for the support that is being offered to them to help them continue with their businesses.

loans.use: to increase stock at her grocery store in the region of Las Pilas, Villanueva

loans.name: Diana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Diana tiene 22 años de edad es soltera tiene tres hijos, vive con los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

VRC CEVALLOS, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN EL RECINTO SAN FRANCISCO, PERTENECE A LA PARROQUIA SAN JUAN DE PUEBLO VIEJO SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRICOLAS.

Diana se dedica a la agricultura la crianza de animales como gallinas y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar animales cómo pollos y cerdos y alimento de engorde y crianza.

Con el apoyo del crédito va a comprar mas animales para criar y luego venderlos a un buen precio. Realiza sus compras en la ciudad de Babahoyo y ventas en la ciudad de San Juan y en Ventanas.

El sueño es comprar un terreno.El desafío al que se enfrenta la señora es la falta de dinero para poder comprar los animales.

En su tiempo libre se dedica a hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Diana is 22 years old. She is single and has three children. She lives with her children in Ventanas cantón, in Los Rios province. 

The Cevallos communal bank is located in the small town of San Francisco, which belongs to the San Juan de Pueblo Viejo parish. The members work in agriculture.

Diana raises animals, such as chickens and pigs. She is requesting the loan to buy chickens and pigs and food to raise and fatten them. 

With the support of the loan, she will buy more animals so she can raise them and then sell them at a good price. She makes her purchases in the town of Babahoyo and sells in the towns of San Juan and in Ventanas. 

Her dream is to buy a piece of land. The challenge that she has is the lack of money with which to buy animals.

In her free time she plays sports.

loans.use: to buy chickens and pigs and food to raise and fatten them.

loans.name: Sonia Maria

texts.es:
Sonia tiene 33 años de edad es estado civil Union Libre tiene tres hijos vive con el compañero y los hijos en el Recinto SAN FRANCISCO perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla CEVALLOS se encuentra ubicada el  recinto SAN FRANCISCO, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Sonia se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de  arroz y la crianza de animales de corral como pollos y cerdos. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades, ademas alieto para los animales balanceado. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

El crédito le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos y los cultivos. El sueño es viajar a estados Unbidos en los tiempos libres le gusta hacer caminar por el campo y limpiar la casa.
texts.en:
Sonia is 33 and in a common-law marriage. She lives with her partner and children in the district of San Francisco, belonging to the Ventanas Canton in the Los Rios province.
She belongs to the Cevallos branch, located in the San Francisco district, belonging to the Ventanas Canton. The members work in agriculture and livestock.
Sonia works in agriculture, sowing rice, and raises barnyard animals such as chickens and hogs. With this loan, she will be able to buy supplies such as fertilizers, manure, and insecticides in order to ward off pests and plagues. She will also buy balanced animal feed. She makes her purchases in the city of Ventanas.
This loan will help her to increase her production and income. Her dream is to travel to the United States. In her free time, she enjoys going for walks in the fields and cleaning her home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure, and insecticides, as well as balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Mónica

texts.es:
La señora Mónica  solicita  un préstamo para la terminación de los cuartos que esta construyendo en la parte trasera de su casa. Ya que sus hijos están creciendo y necesitan mas espacio.
La señora Mónica es empleado de una fábrica con el aria de producción desde hace dos años, y su esposo trabaja en un taller de herrería como soldador desde hace 5 años.
Con el sueldo que recibe la señora Mónica es para pagar el crédito y que el ingreso de su esposo es para pagar los gastos familiares y escolares de sus dos hijos que están estudiando la primaria y que los otras dos tiene un año de nacidos.
Desea mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos y que el patrimonio de sus hijos este en las mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Monica is requesting a loan to finish the rooms she is building onto the back of her house. Her children are growing and they need more space.

Monica has worked in a factory on a production line for two years, and her husband has worked in a blacksmith’s shop as a welder for 5 years.

The salary that Monica earns is for paying back the loan, and her husband’s salary is for paying the household and school expenses. Two of her children are in primary school and the other two are one year old.

She wants to improve her children’s quality of life and she also wants their home to be in good conditions.

loans.use: to finish a room.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, de 57 años, es una mujer emprendedora, honesta y muy trabajadora, es madre soltera desde los 17 años y tiene un hija de 40 años, vive sola en su casa propia y día a día pone todo el empeño en las cosas que hace para continuar su vida y generarse sus ingresos. El trabajo de Rosa consiste en la venta de prendas de vestir para hombres y mujeres adultos, generalmente entrega por pedido de manera ocasional ya sea quincenal o mensual, tiene clientes que se lo solicitan y ella se encarga de conseguir las prendas de otra ciudad, sus ganancias por esta actividad son muy buenas ya que la ropa que ofrece son de marcas de calidad y confeccionados con buenos materiales. Lleva en esta actividad desde hace 06 años y afirma que no ha recibido ninguna queja por parte de sus clientes. Sin embargo, como toda persona emprendedora, comparte esta actividad con otro trabajo que es la lavandería, ella se encarga de lavar la ropa a mano principalmente de policías y es un oficio que ha podido desarrollar muy bien en la comodidad de su hogar. Tiene una afección física en las piernas que le obliga a caminar con la ayuda de muletas, por lo que algunas veces necesita de ayuda, aunque por lo general siempre trabaja sola, a pesar de ello continúa trabajando todos los días para ganarse el pan con el sudor de su trabajo.
Le gusta mucho lo que hace porque siente que le demuestra a las personas que a pesar de algunas dificultades siempre se puede seguir adelante, ahora espera establecer algún negocio en su casa y desarrollar ambos trabajos con mayor eficiencia y calidad contando con los implementos necesarios como mostradores de ropa, maniquíes, colgadores, espejos, una buena lavadora y otros accesorios. Por tanto éste será su préstamo numero 06 con la institución MFP, está muy contenta de saber que nuevamente le brindan la confianza para seguir adelante con sus actividades y continuar disfrutando los logros de su trabajo, así mismo se compromete a seguir siendo puntual en sus pagos mensuales y continuar trabajando de manera responsable con los integrantes de su banco comunal ya que todos son personas solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado 1200 soles, comprará mercaderías conformada por polos, camisas, blusas, shorts y pantalones de hombres y mujeres para continuar trabajando, otra parte del dinero lo invertirá en la compra de artículos de lavandería como detergente, jabón y lejía.
texts.en:
Rosa, 57, is an enterprising, honest, and very hardworking woman.  She has been a single mother since she was 17 and she has a 40-year-old daughter.  She lives alone in her own house.  Every day she puts all her effort into the things she does to continue her life and generate an income for herself.

Rosa's job is selling men's and women's clothing.  Generally she delivers on request on a regular basis, whether biweekly or monthly.  She has customers who order from her and she gets the garments from another city.  Her profits for this job are very good because the clothes she sells are quality brands made of good materials.  She has done this job for six years, and she says she has not received any complaints from her customers.

Like any enterprising person, however, she also has another job, which is washing clothes.  She washes clothes by hand, mainly for police officers, and it's a trade she has been able to develop very well in the comfort of her home.  She has a physical condition in her legs that requires her to walk with crutches, and sometimes she needs help.  In spite of this, though, she generally works alone, and she continues working every day to earn her living with the sweat of her labor.

She likes what she does very much because she feels it shows people that one can always get ahead despite some difficulties.  Now she hopes to set up a business in her house and flourish in both jobs with greater efficiency and quality, having the necessary implements such as clothing display counters, mannequins, hangers, mirrors, a good washing machine, and other accessories.  

This will be her sixth loan with MFP.  She's very happy to know that again they're giving her the confidence to get ahead in her jobs and to continue enjoying the successes of her work.  She's also committed to being punctual with her monthly payments and working responsibly with the members of her communal bank, because they all are supportive people.

With the requested amount of 1200 soles [PEN] she'll buy merchandise so she can continue working: polo shirts, shirts, blouses, shorts, and pants for men and women.  She'll invest another portion of the money in buying washing supplies such as detergent, soap, and bleach.

loans.use: to buy polo shirts, shirts, blouses, shorts, and pants

loans.name: Lila Unicia

texts.es:
Lila tiene 40 años de edad es  soltera  tiene dos hijos vive con los hijos SAN FRANCISCO perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla CEVALLOS se encuentra ubicada el  recinto SAN FRANCISCO, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Lila se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de  arroz y la crianza de animales de corral como pollos y cerdos. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades, ademas alieto para los animales balanceado. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

El crédito le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos y los cultivos. El sueño es comprar un terreno, en los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte con los amigos.
texts.en:
Lila, 40, is single and has two children whom she lives with in San Francisco, which belongs to the Ventanas Canton in Los Rios Province. 

She belongs to the Solidarity Group Cevallos, which is located in the precinct of San Francisco. She makes a living doing agricultural and livestock work, such as harvesting rice and raising farmyard animals including chickens and pigs.

With the loan she plans to buy supplies such as fertilizers, insecticides to prevent pests and diseases, and balanced feed for her animals. She purchases these items in the city of Ventanas. 

The loan will help her to increase her income and crops. Her dream is to buy a plot of land. In her free time she likes to play sports with her friends.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides to prevent pests and diseases, and balanced feed for her animals

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz, de 56 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Es conviviente con Luís quien es comerciante y padre de sus  hijos quienes ya son independientes  y a  quienes quiere mucho. Juntos habitan cómodamente una casa alquilada en compañía de su hermana y su sobrino. La a actividad que realiza Beatriz  es la venta de frutas regionales y refrescos de diversos sabores. Para eso instala todos los  días una mesa en el frontis de su casa  donde acomoda sus frutas,  sus refrescos teniendo bastante acogida por su trato amable y el buen sabor de sus refrescos. 
Se inicios hace más de 02 años con un préstamo de MFP, y hasta el momento los viene realizando ella sola, pero en ocasiones le apoya su hija.
Asimismo considera a su negocio bastante rentable por los ingresos que le deja y la buena acogida que tiene su negocio.
Se decidió a empezar con su negocio por necesidad de contar con un oficio para generarse sus propios ingresos, además que en ocasiones los ingresos de su pareja no les alcanzaba, tomando la decisión de apoyarlo con los gatos del hogar , buscando brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
Por tanto, ahora viendo los buenos resultados que está obteniendo, desea continuar con su negocio e incursionar en la venta de abarrotes para eso quiere abrir una bodega en su casa. Por tanto éste será el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP. Se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibirá, de esa manera se sentirá más segura para avanzar con sus planes. Además comenta estar a gusto con su banco comunal pues lo considera un grupo colaborador y responsable.
Con el monto solicitado de 600 nuevos soles,, los invertirá en la compra de bebidas gaseosas para surtir su negocio , también en frutas variadas buscando precios cómodos por sus compras para así tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Beatriz, 56 years old, is a hardworking and persevering woman, with a strong desire to get ahead. She lives with Luis who is a merchant and the father of her children, all of whom are now independent and whom she loves very much. Together they live comfortably in a rented house in the company of her sister and her nephew. 

The activity that Beatriz realizes is the sale of local fruits and refreshments of a variety of flavors. For this work she puts a table in front of her house everyday to accommodate her fruits. Her drinks are quite popular due to her friendly treatment and the good taste of her refreshments.

She began over two years ago with a loan from MFP, and up to now she has been working alone. Occasionally, her daughter helps her. Also, she considers her business quite profitable given the income it provides her and the good reputation which her business has.

She decided to start her business due to the necessity of finding a job to generate her own income. In addition, on occasion the income of her partner was not enough to support the family. She made the decision to support him, seeking to provide a better quality of life for their children.

Now seeing the good results she has achieved, she wishes to continue with her business and to venture into the sale of groceries. For this she wants to open a mini market in her house.

This will be her third loan with MFP. She is grateful for the financial support she will receive, which will help her feel more secure in advancing her plans. Additionally she notes that her communal bank is in good standing as it is considered a collaborative and responsible group. 

With the requested amount of 600 nuevos soles, she will invest in the purchase of soft drinks to stock her business, and also in assorted fruits; she will seek affordable prices for her purchases in order to have higher profits.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks to stock her business and fruit to make refreshments

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos   es un hombre agricultor de 34 años de edad.  El está casado  y  vive en Sololá.  El tiene seis hijos,  de ellos tres mujeres y tres varones pero solo cuatro estudian en una escuela  de la comunidad.

El se dedica a la agricultura cultivando zanahoria y papa  en una parcela que alquila  a unos kilómetros de su casa, esto lo aprendió de un tío porque trabajo con el desde pequeño  en el campo de la agricultura convirtiéndose en su principal trabajo en la actualidad.
El empezó a trabajar su propio cultivo desde hace 10 años, vio las posibilidades de ser independiente y obtener su propia ganancia cultivando estas verduras.   De este modo el solicita un préstamo de   Q  3,500.00 para que el pueda comprar semillas de zanahoria y fertilizante para cultivar  y cosecharlo mejorando sus ingresos junto a su familia. 
El sueña con la compra de una parcela y no seguir pagando renta  también el desea seguir apoyando a sus hijos y que sigan estudiando en la escuela.
texts.en:
Santos is a 34-year-old farmer. He is married and lives in Sololá. He has six children, three girls and three boys. Only four of them attend school in the community.
Santos cultivates carrots and potato on a rented plot of land a few kilometres away from his home. He learned this work from an uncle, and began working in the fields at a young age. This is now his main source of income.
He started to grow his own crops ten years ago. He saw the possibility of being independent and making his own income cultuvating vegetables. He is requesting a loan of Q  3,500 in order to buy carrot seeds and fertilizer so that he can improve his family's income.
He dreams of purchasing a plot of land so that he won't have to keep renting. He also wants to keep supporting his children and for them to stay in school.

loans.use: to buy carrot seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, de 58 años, es una mujer honrada, amigable y muy trabajadora, conviviente hace 37 años con  Ernesto de 61 años con quien tiene 06 hijos de los cuales el último es menor de edad y aún está en etapa escolar. Viven cómodamente en su casa propia. El trabajo de  Rosa consiste en la venta de productos de primera necesidad como tomates, plátanos, limones, huevos y algunos artículos de primera necesidad, su actividad la realiza en el frontis de su propia vivienda donde todos los días desde muy temprano coloca una mesa en la que ofrece a la venta todos estos productos. Lo que ofrece al público lo renueva a diario comprando en el mercado de la ciudad al por mayor, selecciona las verduras mas frescas y saludables, todas estas características ella ya conoce bien con tan solo al observar el producto, por los años de experiencia que ya tiene en éste negocio. Trabaja sola la mayor parte del tiempo, pero ocasionalmente su hijo lo ayuda cuando ella tiene que realizar algunas labores del hogar. Lleva en esta actividad cerca de 05 años le agrada la comodidad y la tranquilidad con la que puede generar sus ingresos económicos en su propia casa. Por otra parte, hace 15 años se dedica a la venta de pescados al por mayor por temporadas. También forma parte de una asociación de vendedores que se encargan de exportar los mejores ejemplares de pescados de los ríos de su ciudad.
Le gusta mucho lo que hace porque con los dividendos que obtiene de las ventas de sus productos puede apoyar a su pareja con los gastos básicos de su hogar, por eso espera instalar mas adelante una bodega en el que tenga productos diversos que vender y incremente sus ganancias  para continuar brindándole todo lo necesario a hijo y  su familia. Por tanto éste será su préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP, agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en ella para recibir éste crédito, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera responsable y puntual, además le agrada ser parte del banco comunal al que pertenece ya que ha visto que sus integrantes son personas solidarias y muy cumplidas.
Con el monto solicitado 1000 nuevos soles comprará mayor cantidad de productos de primera necesidad para ponerlos a la venta y empezar con la creación de su bodega.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 58, is an honest, friendly, and very hard-working woman. She has lived with Ernesto, age 61, for 37 years and they have 6 children together. Their youngest child is still school-aged. They live comfortably in their own home. Rosa sells basic staples such as tomatoes, bananas, lemons, eggs, and various basic staples. She runs her business out of the front of her home. Every morning, very early, she sets up a table to sell her wares. She replenishes her stock daily, buying wholesale in the city market. She selects the freshest and healthiest vegetables, and knows very well how to do so just from looking at the product due to her years of experience in this business. She works on her own most of the time, but sometimes her son helps her when she has to do certain jobs around the house. She has had this business for about 5 years and she enjoys being able to make an income with comfort and tranquility from her own home. Also, for 15 years she has sold fish wholesale, seasonally. She is also part of a vendors' association that works to export the very best fish from the rivers in the city.
She likes her work very much because her income from her sales allows her to support her partner with the basic household costs. For this reason, she hopes to open a store in the future and to sell various products in order to increase her income. This will allow her to continue to provide her family with every necessity. This will be her second loan with MFP. She is grateful for this opportunity and for the confidence that has been placed in her. She also promises to repay her quotas responsibly and punctually. She is grateful to be part of her communal bank, because she has seen that the members are united and capable.
With the requested 1000 nuevos soles, she will buy a larger quantity of basic staples to sell and start her store.

loans.use: to buy basic staples.

loans.name: Kelly

texts.es:
Kelly, de 21 años, es una mujer buena, amable y muy trabajadora, es soltera y no tiene hijos ya que desea primero poder formarse profesionalmente. Vive en casa de sus padres en donde todos los días comparte con ellos la alegría de estar juntos y trabajar para poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Kelly consiste en la venta de comida, todos los días sale a la vereda de su casa por las tardes para ofrecer a las venta los deliciosos platillos típicos de la región que acompaña con refrescantes bebidas preparados con frutas naturales, brinda siempre un trato amable, una buena sazón y alimentos hechos con ingredientes de la mejor calidad. Lleva realizando este trabajo por 04 años. Empezó siendo ayudante de su madre quien ahora le dio el control total del negocio. Además de trabajar también esta  estudiando y tiene que darse tiempo para dedicarse a sus labores académicas y sobre todo para generar los ingresos necesarios que le permitan cubrir los gastos que demanda su formación profesional. Anteriormente vendía jugos y panes durante las mañanas pero tuvo que cambiar de actividad debido a la importancia que representa para ella forjarse una carrera académica.
Le gusta mucho lo que hace ya que aparte de tener un tiempo disponible para otras funciones, también le genera muy buenas ganancias, antes de poder realizar este trabajo tenia problemas con el pago de sus mensualidades en el instituto en donde estudia, pero ahora está más tranquila ya que tiene un respaldo económico que le permite enfrentar cualquier situación en la que requiera hacer uso de dinero, le gustaría mucho poder agrandar su negocio y poner más mesas, sillas e implementarlo con algunos utensilios que aun le faltan. Por tanto éste será su préstamo número 06 con la institución MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que le brindan un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio, ella por su parte se compromete una vez mas a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual así como lo hizo en sus créditos anteriores, esta muy feliz de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son muy amables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá totalmente en la compra de ingredientes e insumos como arroz, pollo, aceite, aceitunas y frutas, además de otros artículos como 2 mesas, 8 sillas, una docena de platos y otros utensilios que necesita para poder seguir realizando su trabajo y brindar una mejor atención.
texts.en:
Kelly is 21 years old. She is a good, friendly, and hardworking person. She is single and doesn’t have children, since her goal is to develop her career. She lives in her parent’s house, where each day she shares with them the joy of being together and working to provide them with a better quality of life.

Kelly’s work consists of selling food. Every day she goes out to the sidewalk in front of her house in the afternoon to sell the delicious foods that are typical of the region, which are accompanied by refreshing drinks made with natural fruits. She provides friendly service and well-seasoned food made with the highest quality ingredients. She has been doing this work for 4 years. She started by helping her mother, who has now given her control of the business. In addition to working, she is also studying and she has to give herself time to study and also time to generate the income needed to cover her school expenses.

She used to sell breads and juices in the mornings, but she had to change her business because it is very important to her to work on her academic studies.

She likes very much what she does because, aside from leaving her time for other activities, it also generates very good income. Before doing this work, she had problems with the monthly payments at the institute where she studies. Now she feels better because she has the economic support that allows her to confront any situation that requires money. She would very much like to grow her business and have more tables and chairs, and some utensils that she needs. This would be her 6th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She is very happy knowing that they provide her with financial support, since this makes her feel confident she will be able to advance in her business. For her part, she pledges to once again make her repayments in a punctual manner, as she did with her previous loans. She is very happy to belong to her communal bank because all the members are very friendly and supportive. 

With the requested amount of PEN 1,000.00 (Peruvian nuevos soles), she will use all of it to buy ingredients such as rice, chicken, cooking oil, olives, and fruits. She will buy 2 tables, 8 chairs, a dozen plates, and other utensils that she needs in order to continue to do her work and provide better service.

loans.use: to buy rice, chicken, cooking oil, olives, and fruits, and 2 tables, 8 chairs, a dozen plates, and other utensils that she needs

loans.name: Felix Oswaldo

texts.es:
Felix  es de  estado civil soltero no tiene hijos vive con los padres en el Recinto TARIRA perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla RENACER se encuentra ubicada el  recinto TARIRA, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Felix se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. El crédito le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos y los cultivos. 

El sueño es comprar un carro para el trabajo. En los tiempos libres le gusta criar pollos.
texts.en:
Felix is single and has no children.  He lives with his parents in the Tarira area, part of the Ventanas settlement, within the Los Rios province.

He is a member of the Ventanilla communal bank and farms and raises livestock. 

Felix raises corn and rice.  He will use the money from this loan to buy supplies such as fertilizers, compost, and insecticides to prevent blight and disease.  He will make his purchases in Ventanas.  The loan helps him improve his crops and increase his income.  His dream is to buy a car for work.  He likes to raise chickens in his spare time.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina, de 32 años, es una mujer optimista y muy trabajadora, ama mucho a la familia que formó con Henry quien es su conviviente con quien tiene una relación de pareja desde hace muchos años, fruto de su amor tiene 02 hijos menores que le impulsan a ser cada día mejor, vive en la casa de sus padres y todos los días se levanta con muchas ganas de hacer las cosas bien para mejorar su calidad de vida. El trabajo de  Karina consiste en  la venta de comidas típicas, tiene su puesto de ventas en el mercado más concurrido de la ciudad, le encanta cocinar es por eso que no duda en preparar y poner a la venta todos los días los platillos más deliciosos que caracterizan a la región tropical de la selva del Perú, prepara los mejores guisados y los caldos más ricos, es por ello que todos los comensales que acuden a su puesto salen muy satisfechos y agradecidos por el exquisito sabor que caracterizan sus comidas, acompaña sus potajes con las bebidas más refrescantes elaboradas de las mejores frutas de la zona. Su rutina empieza todos los días a las 04 de la mañana y culmina pasando el mediodía. Desde que se inició en esta actividad trabaja sola, hace aproximadamente 3 años y desde entonces ha visto con gran emoción el crecimiento de su negocio y la preferencia del público.
Para el futuro de su negocio espera tener un restaurante, donde pueda vender la comida que prepara durante todo el día y con mayor tranquilidad, por que actualmente solo lo hace por la mañana, aunque ya ha ganado experiencia en éste trabajo siente que todavía le sigue siendo difícil atender a todos los clientes que tiene; no obstante espera que todo el esfuerzo que realiza produzca buenos frutos como hasta ahora ya que lo único que desea es seguir adelante. Por tanto éste será su préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero para concretar sus planes. Además de estar a gusto con su banco comunal pues conoce a sus integrantes y los considera ser personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado 1000 nuevos soles comprará ingredientes e insumos que necesita para continuar preparando sus comidas, también implementará su puesto de venta comprando algunas mesas y sillas que le hacen falta para recibir mas clientes.
texts.en:
Karina, 32, is an optimistic and very hardworking woman.  She very much loves the family she had with Henry, her longstanding partner for many years.  The fruit of their love is two younger children, who motivate her to be better every day.  She lives in her parents' house and gets up every day with a great desire to do things well to improve her quality of life.

Karina's job is selling traditional food.  She has her sales stall in the busiest market in the city.  She loves to cook, so every day she makes and sells the most delicious dishes from the tropical jungle region of Peru.  She makes the best stews and the most delicious broths.  This is why the diners who go to her stall leave very satisfied and grateful for the exquisite taste of her food.  Her dishes are accompanied by the most refreshing beverages made of the best fruits of the region.

Her routine starts every day at 4 in the morning and ends after noon.  She has worked alone since she started this business about three years ago.  Since then, she has been excited to see the growth of her business and the preference of her customers.

For the future of her business she hopes to have a restaurant where she can sell her food all day and more calmly.  Currently she does it only in the morning.  Although she has gained a lot of experience in this job, she feels it's still difficult to wait on all of her customers.  Nevertheless, she hopes that all her efforts will produce good results, as they have up to now, because all she wants is to get ahead.

This will be her second loan with MFP.  She's grateful for the financial support to firm up her plans.  In addition, she's comfortable with her communal bank because she knows the members and considers them to be responsible and supportive people.

With the requested amount of 1000 nuevos soles [PEN] she'll buy the ingredients and supplies she needs to continue preparing her food.  She'll also set up her sales stall, buying some tables and chairs she needs to serve more customers.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her dishes, tables, and chairs

loans.name: Tulio

texts.es:
Tulio, tiene 38 años, es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador, convive hace quince años con Rosa de 39 años de edad, juntos trajeron al mundo a 03 hermosos hijos de 16, 07 y 03 años respectivamente y es por ello que se dedica a trabajar muy duramente para brindarles todo lo mejor.  El objetivo de que sus hijos se sientan cómodos y pongan todo de su parte para salir adelante, todos viven en su casa propia la que  construyo con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo.
El trabajo que tiene Tulio consiste en ofrecer a la venta todo tipo de abarrotes, verduras y otros artículos de primera necesidad, tiene una pequeña bodega que a acondicionado en el interior de su  casa propia.  Todos los días con ayuda de su pareja se encarga de atender a los clientes que acuden a su bodega a comprar los productos necesarios para la preparación de sus alimentos como panes, huevos, azúcar, leche entre otros, su tienda está abierta desde las cinco de la mañana y el se encarga de atender con mucho respeto y con total elocuencia a cada uno de sus clientes, tiene éste negocio alrededor de 01 año, lamentablemente aún siente que los ingresos que percibe por las ventas no le alcanza para brindarle a su familia una vida digna, por ese motivo trabaja todavía desde hace 09 años como estibador en el puerto fluvial de la ciudad, ahí se encarga de cargar y descargar los botes y canoas que llegan repletos de mercaderías y por ello recibe un pago justo.
Desde que inició su negocio de venta de abarrotes tuvo muchas dificultades, por ejemplo, la falta de capital para continuar renovando sus artículos, sin embargo con el tiempo a mejorado ésta actitud y a aprendido a tener paciencia y se dio cuenta que nunca está solo para enfrentar los problemas ya que en todo momento recibe el apoyo de su familia todo eso le ha ayudado a mejorar y espera pronto poder consolidar su economía. Por tanto éste será su préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP, agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en él para recibir éste crédito, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual, además le agrada ser parte del banco comunal al que pertenece ya que ha visto que sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado 1000 nuevos soles comprará productos para su tienda de abarrotes ya que desea surtir su tienda con mayor diversidad de productos de distintas marcas.
texts.en:
Tulio, 38 years old, is a very responsible and hardworking man. He has lived with Rosa, 39 years old, for 15 years. Together they brought into the world three beautiful children of 16, 7 and 3 years old, respectively, and it is for them that they work very hard to provide them the best of everything. With the objective of ensuring their children's comfort, they put their all into getting ahead. They live in their own house which he built with much effort and work.

The work that Tulio has consists in offering for sale all types of groceries, vegetables, and other articles of first necessity. He has a small shop which is located inside his own house. Everyday with help from his partner he is responsible for attending to the customers who come to his shop to buy necessary products for food preparation such as breads, eggs, sugar, and milk among others. His store is open from 5 in the morning and he takes it upon himself to attend to each one of his customers with much respect and eloquence. 

He has had this business for around 1 year, though lamentably he still feels that the income that he gets from his sales is not enough to provide for his family a dignified life. For this reason, he continues his job of 9 years as a stevedore in the river port of the city, where he responsible for loading and unloading the boats and canoes that arrive full of goods and for this he receives a fair payment.

From the time he started his business selling groceries he has had many difficulties - for example, the lack of capital to continue restocking his goods. Nonetheless with time he has improved this attitude and has learned to have patience and realize he is never alone in facing his problems since he can count on the support of his family at any moment. All of this has helped him to improve and he hopes to be able to consolidate his savings soon.

This will be his second loan with MFP. He is grateful for the opportunity and the trust they place in him to receive this loan. On his side he promises to comply with the payment of his quotas in a punctual manner. Additionally he is grateful to be part of his communal bank as he has seen that the members are responsible and supportive people.

With the requested amount of 1,000 nuevos soles, he will buy products for his grocery store since he wishes to stock his shop with a greater variety of products of different brands.

loans.use: to buy products of basic necessity.

loans.name: Qiñe Mapu Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Quiñe Mapu” está conformado por 18 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; cocteleria, comida rápida, negocio, confección de ropa, venta de joyas, venta de carteras, artesanía, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Linares.
Guadalupe, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en primera fila, ocupando el quinto lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste una blusa de color rosada, pantalones oscuros, su cabello es de color castaño claro y lo usa corto.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de comida rápida, desde hace 6 años. Comenta habilito una parte de su casa en  el antejardín para poner su puesto y así ofrecer sus empanadas, pastel de choclo y lasaña según la temporada que se encuentre, además tiene un camión que lo utiliza como medio de transporte para realizar compras para su negocio.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando los compra en ferias y diferentes supermercados a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito arreglará el camión que le sirve como medio de transporte.
Una de las metas de Guadalupe es poder entregar sus productos alimenticios a locales más grandes, así con esto generar mayores ingresos y optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Guadalupe vive junto a su esposo, dos hijos de 27 17 años de edad y un nieto de 8 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel familiar es darle una buena educación a sus hijos, y a nivel laboral crecer dia a dia para poder agrandar su negocio.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Comenta que las capacitaciones han sido fundamentales para su negocio y también para su desarrollo personal, ya que ha aprendido a organizar y distribuir de mejor manera sus ingresos e inversiones.
Linares es un importante centro urbano de la región del Maule, ubicado en la zona centro del país. En esta zona se desarrolla de manera importante la producción agrícola y también vitivinícola sobresaliendo en el ámbito de las exportaciones. Destacan los cultivos de cereales (arroz, trigo, maíz y avena), hortalizas (remolacha, repollo, lechuga y acelga y legumbres) y frutas. Linares es la principal provincia productora de arroz, en Chile; de hecho, el 78% de la producción nacional de este cereal se da en esta provincia, especialmente en la comuna de Parral.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Quiñe Mapu” and is made up of 18 entrepreneurs who have different business including a cocktail restaurant, fast food, clothes making, jewelry sales, wallet sales, arts and crafts and other services.  They are all from the city of Linares.

Guadalupe is part of the communal bank and is shown in the first row of the picture, fifth from the left, wearing pink top, dark pants, with short brown hair.

She sells fast food and has for six years.  She says that she set up part of her patio to set up a stand where she can sell empanadas, choclo cakes, and lasagna, depending on the season.  She also has a truck and uses it as a means of transport to make her purchases for the business.

She buys her supplies and merchandise at fairs and different supermarkets at low cost, so it’s convenient for her.
 
She will use the money from this loan to fix up her truck.

One of Guadalupe’s goals is to be able to deliver her food products to larger stores.  In this way she can generate more income and have a better quality of life.

Guadalupe lives with her husband and two children, ages 27 and 17, and with an 8 year old grandson.  Her dreams for her family are to be able to provide her children with a good education and create new things every day so that she can expand her business.

She is very happy about the opportunity through Fondo Esperanza because it allows her to invest in her business.  She says that the training has been fundamental for her business and also for her personal development.  She has learned to organize and distribute her income and inventory more effectively.

Linares is an important urban center in the Maula region, located in the country’s central zone.  Here, agricultural production in an important export.  They raise cereal grains (rice, wheat, corn, oats), vegetables (beets, cabbage, lettuce, chard, beans), and fruit.  Linares is the main rice producer in Chile and provides 78% of the total production, mainly in Parral.

loans.use: to repair her truck.

loans.name: Laizamon

texts.es:
Laizamón, tiene 61 años, es un hombre honrado, humilde y muy trabajador, convive hace 36 años al lado de Edith de 57 años con quien tiene 04 hijos mayores de edad, vive con toda su familia en su casa propia que es  amplia la cual construyó con sus propias manos por lo que se siente muy orgulloso de haberle brindado a sus hijos un lugar donde vivir.
El trabajo de Laizamón consiste en la fabricación de mesas, sillas o cualquier otro mueble de madera y la construcción de casas, es muy reconocido en su sector por la calidad y la rapidez con que ejecuta sus obras, siempre es solicitado sobre todo en temporadas de invierno que es cuando las casas de su barrio sufren algunas deficiencias o requieren alguna refacción, él se encarga de esta actividad junto a 03 personas que lo ayudan a hacer su realizar su actividad con mejor ánimo y con mayor seguridad. Lleva en éste trabajo más de 26años, le gusta mucho crear viviendas o muebles que se vean hermosas. Cuando no tiene contratos de construcción trabaja al lado de su conviviente en el puesto de venta de verduras que establecieron juntos hace 21 años y que también es su otra fuente de ingreso, tiene una chacra de donde algunas veces se abastece de los productos que ponen a la venta.
Aunque reconoce que su trabajo le ha permitido conseguir el dinero necesario para solventar sus gastos familiares, siente que los años de intensa actividad están produciéndole cansancio, es por eso que desea dedicarse al negocio de la venta de verduras junto a su esposa porque considera que es más tranquilo y no tiene que pasar días completos bajo el sol trabajando en alguna obra. Quiere implementar su puesto y hace crecer su negocio. Por tanto éste será su préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP, está muy contenta de poder contar con el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo, ya que así avanzara con su negocio y se convertirá en una gran empresaria. Por otro lado nos comenta que está muy contenta por ser parte de un grupo responsable.
Con el monto solicitado 800 nuevos soles comprará algunos herramientas de uso común en su trabajo y surtirá su puesto de venta de verduras comprando productos al por mayor.
texts.en:
Laizamón is 61 years old. He is an honorable, humble, and very hardworking person. He has lived for 36 years with Edith, who is 57 years old and with whom he has 4 grown children. He lives with his whole family in their own house, which is large and which he built with his own hands. He feels very proud of having given his children a place to live.

Laizamón’s work consists of making tables, chairs, and any other kind of furniture made of wood, and also of building houses. He is well-known in the area for the quality and speed with which he does his work. People always seek him out, especially in winter, which is when the houses in his neighborhood have some problems or need some fixing. He does this work alongside 3 people who help him do his work with good spirit and better safety. He has been working in this business for 26 years. He really likes building houses and furniture that are beautiful. When he doesn’t have construction contracts, he works with his wife at her vegetable selling business, which they establisted 21 years ago. She brings in another income. She has a field where she sometimes grows the products they sell.

Though he recognizes that his work has allowed him to earn the money needed to cover the household expenses, he feels that the years of intense activity are making him tired. This is why he would like to work in the business selling vegetables with his wife, because he finds it to be calmer and he doesn’t have to spend entire days beneath the sun. He wants to start his own stand and grow his business. This would be his 2nd loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. He is very happy to be able to count on the financial support he receives, since this is how he will advance with his business and become a great business owner. He also tells us that he is very happy to be part of a responsible group.

With the requested amount of PEN 800.00 (Peruvian nuevos soles), he will buy some commonly-needed tools for his job and he will stock his vegetable stand by buying products at wholesale price.

loans.use: to buy woodworking tools and vegetables.

loans.name: Enrique Marino

texts.es:
Enrique tiene 43 años de edad de estado civil casado tiene dos hijos vive con la esposa y los hijos en el Recinto ZAPOTAL NUEVO perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla LOS AMIGOS se encuentra ubicada el  recinto ZAPOTAL NUEVO  , perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Enrique se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz y la crianza de animales de corral como pollos y patos. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como:  abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades, ademas alieto para los animales balanceado. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

El sueño es comprar un terreno, en los tiempos libres le gusta salir de paseo con la familia.
texts.en:
Enrique, 43, is married with two children. He lives with his wife and children in the Zapotal Nuevo neighborhood, in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios Province. He belongs to the Los Amigos communal bank, which is located in the Zapotal Nuevo neighborhood, in the Ventanas Canton. The members of this communal bank work farming and ranching. 
Enrique works in agriculture, planting corn and raising animals like chickens and ducks. With the loan, he will be able to buy supplies like manure, insecticide to avoid plagues and diseases, and balanced feed for the animals. He makes these purchases in the city of Ventanas. His dream is to buy land. In his free time, he likes to go for walks with his family.

loans.use: to buy manure, insecticides to avoid plagues and sicknesses, and balanced feed for the animals.

loans.name: Agapito Heriberto

texts.es:
Agapito tiene 37 años de edad es casado tiene un hijo vive con la esposa y con el hijo en el Recinto ZAPOTAL NUEVO perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla LOS AMIGOS se encuentra ubicada el  recinto ZAPOTAL NUEVO  , perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Agapito se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz y la crianza de animales de corral como pollos y patos. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos para evitar las plagas , ademas alieto para los animales balanceado. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

El sueño es comprar un terreno para construir la casa, en los tiempos libres le gusta jugar indor.
texts.en:
Agapito is 37 years old, married, and has a son.  He lives with his wife and son in the Zapotal Nuevo area of the Ventanas settlement, within the Los Rios province.  He is a member of the “Los Amigos” group and farms and raises livestock.

He raises corn and corral animals such as chickens and ducks.  He will use the money to buy supplies such as fertilizers and compost to prevent blights.  He will also buy balanced feed and make his purchases in Ventanas.

His dream is to buy land so he can build a house.  In his free time he likes to play indor.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.es: Tengo un negocio en mi casa de venta de calzadoy productos de avon para dama, en esta  temporada me gustaría invertir un poco en la compra de mercancía, gracias a dios he logrado tener muchas clientes,  de este negocio vivimos mis hijos y yo. Solicito el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercancía  para mi negocio.
texts.en:
I have a business in my home selling footwear products for ladies. This season I would like to invest a little in the purchase of merchandise. 

Thanks to God, I have managed to have many customers. This business supports me and my children.

I request this loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise for my business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Segundo Arturo

texts.es:
Arturo tiene 70 años de edad es  divorciado  tiene dos hijos vive solo en el Recinto ZAPOTAL NUEVO perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla LOS AMIGOS se encuentra ubicada el  recinto ZAPOTAL NUEVO  , perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Arturo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz y la crianza de animales de corral como pollos y patos. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades, ademas alieto para los animales balanceado. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

El sueño es comprar un terreno, en los tiempos libres le gusta salir con los perros a caminar.
texts.en:
Arturo is 70 years old and divorced. He has two sons and lives alone in the Zapotal Nuevo area, part of Ventanas canton in Los Rios province.

He belongs to Los Amigos Communal Bank, which is also located in Zapotal Nuevo in Ventanas canton. The members of this group engage in farming and raise livestock. 

Arturo is a farmer who cultivates corn and raises farmyard animals like chickens and ducks. He will use the loan to buy supplies, such as fertilizer, compost, insecticides to avoid plant infestations and disease, as well as feed for his livestock. He will make his purchases in the city of Ventanas.

His dream is to buy some land. In his spare time he enjoys going for a walk with his dogs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, compost, insecticides to avoid plant infestations and disease as well as animal feed.

loans.name: Felix Alberto

texts.es:
Felix tiene 33 años de edad es  de estado civil Union Libre  tiene un hijo vive con la madre en el Recinto SAN FRANCISCO perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla CEVALLOS se encuentra ubicada el  recinto SAN FRANCISCO, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. Es nuevo miembre de la ventanilla. 

Felix se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de  arroz y la crianza de animales de corral como pollos y cerdos. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades, ademas alieto para los animales balanceado. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

El crédito le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos y los cultivos. El sueño es comprar una casa para vivir con la madre, en los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
