She would love to have a store from where she could sell all of her products in quantity.  This will be her 2nd loan through MFP and she is grateful to those who make this loan possible so that she can continue toward her objective.  She is also very committed to making her payments responsibly and is very happy to belong to her communal bank, where all its members are good, friendly, and united.  

She will use the 1,200 PEN from this loan to buy snacks and groceries in bulk to stock her store and continue selling constantly.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Tuna

texts.en:
Tuna is a differently-abled 23-year-old single man. He lives with his parents in Odisha, India.

He has been operating a small bicycle repair store, which is the only source of income for the family. It is a profitable project, but also not enough to cover all the costs of the family's needs. His monthly income is 3,000 INR.

He currently has the skills and equipment to do good repairs and replacements but not the required spare parts for replacement. He has to travel almost 5 kilometers for a good spare part. 

He is requesting a loan of 25,000 INR to cover the costs of purchasing the necessary spare parts used for repairing bicycles and motorbikes. This will provide Tuna with a varied collection of spare parts, which will help to increase his income and improve the family's living standard.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts used for bicycle repairs.

loans.name: Pranati

texts.en:
Pranati is engaged in the activity of selling milk and milk products from her house. She has two cows and two buffaloes at her home. She has been involved in this activity for the past five years. She sells 20 litres of milk daily at the rate of 20 INR per litre. 

She is a 29-year-old lady living with her parents-in-law, one son and one daughter in a village in Odisha, India. After her husband died, she took on all the burdens of her family. To manage her family, she started selling milk with the help of her father-in-law. She takes care of the cows and buffaloes at home and her father-in-law helps her to bring the fodder from the market. She wants to purchase two more cows to grow her business.
 
Pranati has requested a loan of 30,000 INR for purchasing two cows. She says that doing so will let her increase her customers because she can supply milk in a large amount. She also wants to use the loan to repair the cattle shed.

She dreams of giving a better living standard to her family and saving some money for future unfortunates.

loans.use: To purchase two more cows for her milk business and repair the cattle shed.

loans.name: Uuriintsolmon

texts.en:
Uuriintsolmon is 27 years old. He lives with his wife and two children in a house in the Hovd province of Mongolia. His wife, Erdenesuren, age 27, works at a private company as an accountant and she has just given a birth to their newest son. Uuriintsolmon's sons, Bat-Erdene and Monh-Erdene, ages 5 and 1, go to the local kindergarten and stay home with their mother, respectively. 

Uuriintsolmon started his business of a taxi service in 2009. He started a grocery store business in 2010. He sells organic vegetables in his store. Now, he is requesting a loan of MNT 4,000,000 to purchase a large amount of organic vegetables to sell in his grocery store during the winter. Uuriintsolmon is a hard-working, diligent, and honest person.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of organic vegetables to sell in his grocery store during winter.

loans.name: Sokun's Group

texts.en:
Sokun, aged 46 years, is married and resides in a rural area of Battambang province’s Bovel district in Cambodia. She is a mother of seven children, two (sons) of whom are school-aged children and still under her responsibility. 

Sokun has a business farming rice to earn a living for her family. Having been in the current business for ten years, she can earn around KHR 8,000 daily and, after offsetting the daily cost of living, save approximately KHR 3,000 for future needs. 

Sokun’s loan group (Sokun's Group) consists of three female members, all of whom are first-time borrowers with VisionFund Cambodia, Kiva’s partner. Sokun is leading her group to apply for a loan in the amount of KHR 200,000 each (KHR 600,000, collectively). 

As a group representative, Sokun will spend her loan portion on building a latrine for the use of her family. Sokun hopes to create a healthier environment for her beloved family and to avoid unsanitary practices. Once a working latrine is properly installed, Sokun can also help to promote sanitation and hygiene practices in her community.

loans.use: to build a latrine and improve the sanitary conditions of her family.

loans.name: Dusmanta

texts.en:
Dusmanta is a 22-year-old differently able person living with his parents and an elder brother age 24. His brother is working in a factory as a laborer. He owns a small general store at the market where he sells detergents, shampoos, toffees, wafers and oil, earning 7,000 INR per month from his shop. This is the only source of income for the family. Dusmanta has been working hard to develop his business and get married.

He wants to buy more stock including a variety of spices, personal care merchandise like shampoos, detergents, and toothpaste that he is selling right now and more variety of chocolates and wafers.  He has requested a loan of 20,000 INR to purchase a refrigerator and some more stock of what he sells in his shop.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator and a variety of spices, and personal care merchandise like shampoos, detergents, and toothpaste for his general store

loans.name: Ramesh

texts.en:
Ramesh is a 38-year-old differently able person living with his parents, wife and a child who is in school in Odisha, India. He owns a variety store in his village. He sells biscuits, hair oil, talcum powder, soaps, detergents, eggs, chocolates and other daily household consumables. He has good relations with his customers, as he serves his customers in the best way he can.

His family lives on 5,000 INR per month currently and he wants to earn more for betterment of his family. He has requested a loan of 30,000 INR to buy more variety of the stock he is selling right now and offer a better quality and range of products to his customers. He can send his child to a good school and see him well educated.

loans.use: to purchase hair oil, talcum powder, soaps, detergents, eggs, chocolates, etc. for his variety shop.

loans.name: Ashok

texts.en:
Ashok is a 31-year-old physically challenged person living with his parents, wife, and a son who is three years old. He is engaged in the activity of weaving handkerchiefs and saris (Indian traditional dress for women). His parents and his wife are helping him with the weaving. The financial condition of his family is not good. He brings raw materials like cotton, thread and colors from a dealer and gives back the finished goods to him. In return, he gets only the labor cost, which is very little.

He has a plan to bring raw material directly from the market and sell back the finished product in the market. Doing this will increase his income.
He has requested a loan of 20,000 INR to purchase raw materials for weaving handkerchiefs and saris (Indian traditional dress for women). He wants to develop his business and provide a better living style for his family. He also wants to save some money for his family’s future and see his son go to a good school.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for weaving handkerchiefs, and saris (Indian traditional dress for women)

loans.name: Nyamaahuu

texts.en:
Nyamaahuu is 49 years old. She lives with her husband and niece in their small house in the Hovd province of Mongolia. Her husband, Namjildorj, works at a local private company as a driver. Her niece goes to a local secondary school. 

Nyamaahuu has been growing and selling organic vegetables since 1990. She started her business for family use first, then started selling the excess amount as her business later. She has built a bigger storage pit on her plot of land. 

Nyamaahuu is now requesting MNT 2,000,000 to purchase a large amount of seeds and soils to prepare for next year's planting. Nyamaahuu is a hard-working, friendly, and diligent woman.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of seeds and soils to prepare for next year's planting.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Frustrated with routinely joining two uneven picnic tables as a pseudo poker table when entertaining his friends and family, Eric decided to take his construction experience and create a custom poker table for himself, eventually creating M’s Custom Poker Tables.

He shares his experiences on his company website:  “I built my very first table by trial and error, and it turned out well. Then, I started building table after table and I got better at it. I quickly progressed and everyone noticed,” he writes.  “I began to receive calls and drop-ins at my house by people who had heard about the tables and wanted to see them. I looked to see if there was anybody else building poker tables in the Valley, and I found out there was no one local to buy from. So, I got the idea to start building and selling my own custom tables.”

Now 32-year-old Eric creates handmade custom poker tables to sell to discerning customers. Options include any color of cloth, accompanied by dropped-in or swivel brass, bronze, chrome or aluminum cup holders, a variety of wooden or chrome table legs, armrests and wood stains.   Eric will also deliver and set up the tables he creates.

“Other companies may "cut and paste" their work,” Eric says, “But I’m professional. My tables are nice, the designs are nice, and compared to competitors, mine are something that attracts friends to play. I have more than eight different designs for different needs.”  One of his designs even doubles as a dining room table, featuring a removable cover so it can easily convert for an after-dinner card game!

Currently, Eric works with Texas Poker Supplies in Austin to obtain his accessories, but he hopes to one day cut the costs of that middleman, purchase accessories at wholesale prices, and keep them in stock at his home where he works alone. He also occasionally hires helpers when he receives large orders and he will eventually hire a permanent part-time employee.  But he needed a small business loan to lay the groundwork for such growth – including paying for a strong advertising campaign via online “poker realms.”

Thanks to a good friend who knows several previous Accion Texas clients, he was able to successfully apply for and obtain a loan.

Eric is grateful for Accion’s assistance.  “I wouldn’t be struggling, but now I can put money towards ads and that’s how you make money. Accion has helped me as far as being able to do that again.”

loans.use: to fund online advertising.

loans.name: Ry's Group

texts.en: Residing in a rural village of the Bovel district in Cambodia’s Battambang province, Ry is a 48-year-old married woman with seven children, all of whom are dependent on her. To support the family, Ry works as a rice farmer on a five-hectare plot of farm, earning around 13,000 KHR daily. This will be Ry’s first time requesting a loan via VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is leading a loan group of four members who are all females to take out a loan in the amount of 200,000 KHR each. Ry will utilize her loan portion to build a latrine for her family. With the help of this loan, she will be able to create a healthy environment for her kids and avoid unsanitary practices.

loans.use: to build a latrine.
